description: Pirates, rogue holograms, and formerly eradicated diseases are only a few of the problems plaguing this area. Handle each in turn to bring order to the region.

intro.text: "Some information that may be of value to you. The Cardassian war criminal, Gul Darhe'el, is on the run. The Cardassian government has washed their hands of him, and the Bajoran government has promised great physical rewards and probably greater political ones for his arrest. Do with it what you will."

ship.name: Val Jean
ship.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

quests.name: Rabid Fans
quests.description: Morn is attempting to establish a vole fighting ring in Ferengi space, unwittingly spreading a virulent strain of Simperian rabies. Shut it down.

intro.text: Morn makes a noise that might be a laugh, but he avoids your eyes on the viewscreen. He has been accused of starting a vole fighting ring that has triggered an outbreak of rabies in Ferengi space.

stages.text: Stop Morn from Spreading Infected Voles

intro.text: "A lot of people joined the Maquis looking for a license to steal. Seems that's a problem no matter what timeline we're in. I'm passing along the registration of a Maquis ship being used to hijack transports and cargo vessels. We all win if you take them down."

ship.name: Val Jean
ship.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

quests.name: The Professor's Deadline
quests.description: The self-aware Professor hologram has activated himself on your ship's holodeck, and is attempting to release other holograms. He must be stopped!

intro.text: "The Enterprise-D seems to have had no end of trouble with its holodeck. Unfortunately, we've brought some of that trouble back with us. The Professor's shuttlecraft is headed your way. If he gets into your ship's computer... well, the game's afoot."

ship.name: Val Jean
ship.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

intro.text: "I had the misfortune of witnessing the Yamato's destruction once, I don't wish to see it again. Every second that the Iconian program infects their computer another die is cast in a deadly gamble. Shut down that ship, Captain, before it claims everyone aboard."

ship.name: Val Jean
ship.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

quests.name: Serious Business
quests.description: The Dosi have come looking to settle a debt with the Ferengi and are none too pleased to be ignored. Stop them from joining in the war!

intro.text: "Take it from me, you don't want to be in debt with the Dosi. Unfortunately, both Brunt and my brother Rom apparently owe them something, and they've come to collect. If you don't intervene, there might not be a Ferenginar left to fight over."

ship.name: Val Jean
ship.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

intro.text: "You like solving other people's problems. Here's one of minea business partner reneged on a warranty for some vital colony machinery. I have a reputation to uphold. Disable that ship and make our clientsI mean, the colonistshappy."

ship.name: Val Jean
ship.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

quests.name: Operation Isolate
quests.description: Your medical team reports an outbreak of vegan choriomeningitis on your ship! Take steps to halt the plague's progress while Sickbay works on a cure.

intro.text: "I had hoped there would be a cure for vegan choriomeningitis by now, or at least a vaccine. We're getting reports of outbreaks on many ships. If any of your crew members are experiencing fevers or pain in their extremities, don't wait, act!"

description: From renegade androids to ancient civilizations born anew, the temporal crisis has brought chaos to every corner of the galaxy. Set the standard for all Starfleet captains by dealing with each threat in turn.

intro.text: "Priority Alert. A damaged Borg vessel has entered the Alpha Quadrant. If we strike quickly, before the Borg can make repairs, we can eliminate this threat in its infancy."

quests.name: A Tale of Forgotten Lore
quests.description: Lore has beamed aboard your ship, and has begun downloading important information from its computer. Bypass his security lockouts and stop him!

intro.text: "Starfleet won't tell anyone what's going on. I see it's up to me to bring the truth to the masses. I'm sure I'll find what I need on your ship."

stages.text: Locate Lore's Hideout Aboard the Ship

intro.text: "My people are often accused of being thieves, but there are rarely truth to those claims. That isn't the case for this group of pirates preying on an established trade route. They're taking the shortest road to acquisition and it's no good for anybody."

quests.name: A Time of Morn-ing
quests.description: A Lissepian vessel is pursuing a Lurian named Morn, demanding your help in returning the latinum he stole in the Lissepian Mother's Day Heist.

intro.text: Morn, a Lurian known to the crew of Deep Space Nine, stares dolefully at you from your viewscreen. His written distress call indicates he is being pursued by Lissepian authorities for a crime he didn't commit.

stages.text: Offer to Mediate Dispute with Morn
Resolve Matter of the Stolen Latinum

intro.text: "It is not surprising to see how many are taking advantage of this crisis for their own personal gain. We've received reports of a Cardassian ship setting up a minefield to catch any ships that appear as the result of an anomaly. Whether sanctioned or not, they must be stopped."

quests.name: Mortals and Mayhem
quests.description: Q is promising great rewards to Starfleet captains willing to face his gauntlet. Are you among them?

intro.text: "This crisis has already shown me things I've never seen. I'm not entirely certain how you mortals have maintained your sanity. We'd best go through some mental exercises. Shock therapy, I hear it's called!"

stages.text: Begin Gauntlet by Dealing with Bomb
Q Proposes Bliss in Return for Quitting

intro.text: "That imposter in the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance dishonors my name, and I will do anything I can to stop him and his allies. One of his commanders has gone rogue, using his Bird of Prey to hunt Federation vessels. They must be destroyed!"

quests.name: Iconian Insider
quests.description: Determine how the rogue archaeologist Vash is able to steal priceless artifacts without getting caught, and put a stop to it.

intro.text: "The Tal Shiar has reason to believe that a human named Vash may be behind a string of mysterious thefts of ancient Debrune and Romulan relics from heritage sites near the Neutral Zone. If you wish to avoid an incident, apprehend her and return the relics."

stages.text: Gain Access to Romulan Neutral Zone

challenges.name: Use Data to Model Vash's Location

description: "The Federation wouldn't exist without Starfleet. We might be stretched thin, but I'm going to personally ensure that every officer still here is held to the same high standards I hold myself."

quests.name: Bravery in Action
quests.description: The Taranko colony is under attack! Repel the last of the Romulan invaders and help the colonists recover.

crew_requirement.description: You may only use <#808080>Common and <#50AA3C>Uncommon crew with the Starfleet trait on this Cadet Challenge.

screens.text: "You've received commendations from every admiral in this timeline, and a few who should be long dead. After your performance on Taranko, I can see why."

responses.text: "Just doing my duty, sir."
"Any chance to get revenge on the Romulans."
"You're not from this timeline either, are you?"

screens.text: "They're not the only ones taking advantage of this crisis, but they're certainly the best at it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "No, I'm from the future. One potential future, anyway. One I hope doesn't actually come to pass."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I understand many of your officers are new to Starfleet or very early in their careers. The first thing we ask, above all else, is bravery. There are few things braver than heading into a war zone and witnessing civilian casualties, so they're well on their way."

responses.text: "Glad to hear it. But I'm not one to rest on my laurels."
"I wouldn't have them without these anomalies. In a strange way, I'm grateful."
"In these times, beggars can't be choosers."

screens.text: "I know the feeling. Please give my regards to Counselor Troi."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Your officers deserve your confidence as well as your honesty. Remember that."

responses.text: Continue

quests.name: Top Marks
quests.description: The Stargazer is trapped in the Hekaras Corridor, where it will damage surrounding space at warp. Find a way to preserve both ship and space!

intro.text: "A version of the Stargazer is trapped in the Hekaras Corridor. Warp travel destabilizes the surrounding space, and the ship's impulse engines have been damaged. Whatever we do, it can't endanger Hekaras II or any other inhabited planet nearby."

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

crew_requirement.description: You may only use <#808080>Common and <#50AA3C>Uncommon crew with the Starfleet trait on this Cadet Challenge.

screens.text: "If I was a betting man, that would have been an easy bet. Any one of the engineers on your crew could probably stop these anomalies, if we gave them enough time."

responses.text: "We'd be sorry Starfleet officers if we couldn't resolve a scientific quandry."
"You are a betting man, from what I've heard."
"If I'm being honest, I'd rather be fighting Romulans."

screens.text: "Never with my officers' lives."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "In space, that's exactly the kind of attitude that will get you killed."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Being a Starfleet officer is more than picking up a phaser. I had to prove I had a thorough understanding of hyperspace physics just to enter the Academy. Brains give you the edge over brawn every time."

responses.text: "I couldn't agree more, sir. I plan to keep that edge."
"Care to place some credits on that?"
"With all due respect, I'll command my crew as I see fit."

screens.text: "When all this is over. Assuming I haven't vanished into thin air."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "With all due respect, you'll command it like a Starfleet officer."

responses.text: Continue

quests.name: Talk Less, Smile More
quests.description: Refugees of the temporal anomaly crisis are incensed at the requirements to assimilate into Ferengi Traditionalist society. Can you find a compromise?

intro.text: "Whatever diplomatic training you've received, keep repeating it to yourself. The Ferengi Traditionalists have offered to take in refugees, but only if they abide by Ferengi custom, including nudity for females."

ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

crew_requirement.description: You may only use <#808080>Common and <#50AA3C>Uncommon crew with the Starfleet trait on this Cadet Challenge.

screens.text: "I've had the unfortunate pleasure of dealing with the Ferengi before. I have to admit, you were more patient than I would have been."

responses.text: "The Ferengi aren't malicious. Their ways are just different from ours."
"Even now, as a more... mature officer?"
"My crew was patient. I wish an anomaly would carry every Ferengi off."

screens.text: "Yes. Mature enough to pretend you didn't mean old."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "A bit extreme, though I've had my moments."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "When you're the face of humanity, the first contact an alien species has with the Federation, you don't always have the luxury of speaking your mind. A Starfleet officer has to find a way to cooperate with other cultures, even those we find morally repugnant."

responses.text: "I take the responsibility of first contact very seriously."
"But we can't let injustices stand...."
"I don't find the Traditionalists all that repugnant."

screens.text: "That's good, because your next objective is... stand by"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "There's cultural dissonance, and true violation of a sentient being's rights. As captain, you have to know the difference. Stand by"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Then you and I have very little in common. Stand by"

responses.text: Continue

quests.name: Back In Time
quests.description: Temporal anomalies threaten to swallow Admiral Riker's starbase whole! Can you evacuate the crew before the base loses structural integrity?

intro.text: "A temporal anomaly has appeared inside Starbase 24. Officers are disappearing and we're losing structural integrity. You have to get these people out before the whole station breaks apart. Red alert!"

quests.description: Admiral Riker is the only one left on Starbase 24, trapped by a fallen beam. Send an away team down to rescue him!

intro.text: "I'm pinned... you will disregard any order from my evacuated colleagues to rescue me... get to a safe distance and go to warp, now!"

crew_requirement.description: You may only use <#808080>Common and <#50AA3C>Uncommon crew with the Starfleet trait on this Cadet Challenge.

screens.text: "You were given a direct order to leave the system. By coming back for me, you not only put your crew at risk, but also mine. Explain yourself, Captain."

responses.text: "It was a calculated risk, and it paid off."
"You would have done the same thingor at least, Commander Riker would have."
"I would have had a mutiny on my hands otherwise."

screens.text: "This time. Don't think it makes you invincible."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Don't presume to tell me what I would have done, especially when it comes to following orders!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You're the captain of this ship. You're supposed to keep your head when the crew can't."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You went above and beyond the call of duty. Whether I agree with it or not, that's exactly what a Starfleet officer should do. Like so many others now, I owe you my life. Thank you."

responses.text: "Your guidance has been invaluable. Until our next mission."
"Starfleet has a bright future. You'll be glad you didn't miss it."
"Don't thank me just yet. I may ask for a return on the favor...."

description: "I had the honor of serving with Worf, Starfleet's first Klingon recruit, and the Enterprise was all the better for it. A diverse crew is a stronger crew, as I intend to prove."

quests.name: History Interrupted
quests.description: Starfleet's first Xindi recruit has been imprisoned by angry Xindi of the past, who refuse to see one of their own join. Resolve the situtation!

intro.text: "Starfleet was about to welcome its first Xindi recruit... until his revived great-relatives got wind of it. The Xindi war was centuries agowe need to convince them to stand down."

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

crew_requirement.description: You may only use <#808080>Common</color> and <#50AA3C>Uncommon</color> crew who are <#CC0000>alien</color> or <#CC0000>part alien</color> on this Cadet Challenge.

screens.text: "I suppose if I was asked to join the Romulans or the Dominion, I might find it strange too. But we can't permanently label someone our enemy. Starfleet wouldn't exist. Hell, the Federation wouldn't exist."

responses.text: "Anyone who's willing to serve is welcome on my ship."
"What's your opinion of the Federation in this timeline?"
"There are some species that will never be part of my crew."

screens.text: "I wish your temporally displaced colleagues felt the same."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You won a war I never had to fight, against shapeshifters who infiltrated every level of Starfleet. Frankly, it's made you all a little paranoid."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You're more than a citizen of Earth, or a member of humanity. You're one of many beings who share this galaxy. Whether we're enemies or friends, there's something to be learned from all of them."

responses.text: "I look forward to whatever I learn next."
"Your service record indicates you weren't always so enlightened."
"Like which ones to avoid...."

screens.text: "Age can do that to a man. Age, and loss."

responses.text: Continue

quests.name: Incompatible With Life
quests.description: A group of Benzite officers are in danger after they were transported via temporal anomaly onto an NX-class ship. Help the crew ensure their survival!

intro.text: "We've got a medical emergency on an NX-class ship. These early models were only built to support certain lifeforms, and a large number of Benzite officers have appeared onboard."

intro.text: "I'm told my counterpart in this universe got to accompany Zefram Cochrane on his historic flight. It doesn't seem to have gone so wellhe's landed on Kreetassa, and whatever offense he caused is grounds for execution."

screens.text: "Put your continuing mission on hold. Starfleet Intelligence has discovered Data's brother, Lore, is constructing android copies of several key officers. What he plans to do with them, I can't say, except that it must be stopped."

responses.text: "Understood. What's our plan of attack?"
"Androids pretending to be humans? They'll be easy to spot."
"We should let it play out, see what we learn from our enemy."

screens.text: "Lore is not your typical android. He'll program these doppelgangers with all of his guile and none of his weaknesses."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Is insubordination a formal class at the academy now?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Our first objective is to find a way to identify these androids from a distance. Lore will no doubt take measures to make them blend in, even on a cellular level. I hope you've brushed up on your exobiology."

responses.text: "Flesh and blood or not, I'll treat them with respect."
"No android is a match for me."
"That's what my diverse crew is for, sir."

quests.name: Flesh and Blood
quests.description: Starfleet needs a way to identify Lore's android doppelgangers without violating anyone's privacy. Can you develop a method that everyone approves?

intro.text: "Some veterans of the Dominion War are calling to establish a database of officer DNA. I trust you can come up with a better solution for finding these androids?"

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 100.

rewards.name: Training

crew_requirement.description: You may only use <#808080>Common</color> and <#50AA3C>Uncommon</color> crew who are <#CC0000>alien</color> or <#CC0000>part alien</color> on this Cadet Challenge.

screens.text: "Starfleet Intelligence has uncovered more about Lore's plan. His androids won't be unique, autonomous individuals like himself. Instead, Lore will exert direct control over them via a shared neural net."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Our best option, tactically, is to redirect control from the inside out. Allow a compatible mind to join Lore's net, then shut his androids down."

responses.text: "I'm on board. Is Commander Data?"
"Any compatible mind in particular?"
"I'd prefer to go after Lore directly."

screens.text: "No. Data has been susceptible to Lore's control before. We can't take that risk."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I don't give orders on the basis of what you'd prefer to do."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Several Borg have been brought into this timeline via temporal anomaly. They're cut off from the Collective, many have discovered their individuality, even assimilated into Starfleet crews... we think they would be the best choice."

responses.text: "I see the tactical sense in this... and the risk."
"Give a Borg control of an android army? Are you crazy?"
"I refuse to trust a Borg with the lives of my crew."

screens.text: "A Borg could easily link with Lore's neural net, but couldn't be won over by anything he offered. They're driven by efficiency and the need to complete their objective."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I would have agreed with you, once. But I've met Borg detached from the Collective, read up on those who've served on other ships... there's still life in them."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Even after his time as Locutus, I would still trust Captain Picard with my life."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You're a Starfleet captain. How you stop Lore and his androids is ultimately your decision. But if you allow your prejudices to blind you to the best solution, you risk defeat."

responses.text: "If a Borg is the best solution, then that's what I'll do."
"I'll consult my crew and do what they recommend."
"I won't be defeated. You can be sure of that."

screens.text: "The Orion have a sad history when it comes to the treatment of women, androgynous persons, or anyone else who might make them a profit. I had hoped things might be different in this timeline."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Federation has had its flaws, and unfortunately they're coming back. There are some officers here who prefer the days when the only woman on the bridge was a yeoman with their coffee."

responses.text: "As chaotic as the present is, I much prefer it to the past."
"There's no shame in such duties, for any gender."
"You're one to talk about treating women professionally."

screens.text: "There is when that's the only position available to them."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "In professional situations, yes. My personal life isn't a matter of record."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Starfleet sets the standard. That's why you and I are going to continue intervening in situations of gender abuse across the Federation, with female officers whenever possiblejust to drive the point home."

responses.text: "My officers are more than capable, no matter their gender."
"You don't give our citizens enough credit. They'll stand up to injustice."
"I'm not convinced this is as widespread a problem as you say...."

screens.text: "The attack on the Renegade was only an effort to gain control of a Starfleet ship. We've learned the Talarians plan to launch a full-scale attack on Angel I. Without the Renegade, they'll have to rely on their all-male army."

responses.text: "They're sure to lose, then."
"What is the Talarians' quarrel with Angel I?"
"Should we be taking sides in this matter?"

screens.text: "Angel I isn't much better. For most of their history, they subjugated their male citizens."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Talarian society is strictly patriarchal. Angel I is ruled by an elected matriarchy. I attempted to... negotiate with them once."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Federation doesn't make a habit of imposing its values on others. But Angel I is now a member of the Federation, and they've made great strides in equality since. Defending them isn't just an obligation, it's the right thing to do."

responses.text: "We'll set course for Angel I immediately."
"I hope the Talarians see reason before any torpedoes are launched."
"Orders are orders, but I'd rather let this play out...."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I've written up commendations for several of your officers. When you think they're ready, have them take the Bridge Officer's Test. They've proven any Starfleet ship could use more women at the helm."

responses.text: "I'm grateful for your support on this issue."
"My male officers have a lot of catching up to do...."
"Thanks to their ingenious captain, yes."

description: "I had the honor of serving with Worf, Starfleet's first Klingon recruit, and the Enterprise was all the better for it. A diverse crew is a stronger crew, as I intend to prove."

quests.name: History Interrupted
quests.description: Starfleet's first Xindi recruit has been imprisoned by angry Xindi of the past, who refuse to see one of their own join. Resolve the situtation!

intro.text: "Starfleet was about to welcome its first Xindi recruit... until his revived great-relatives got wind of it. The Xindi war was centuries agowe need to convince them to stand down."

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

crew_requirement.description: You may only use <#5AAAFF>Rare</color> crew who are <#CC0000>alien</color> or <#CC0000>part alien</color> on this Advanced Challenge.

screens.text: "I suppose if I was asked to join the Romulans or the Dominion, I might find it strange too. But we can't permanently label someone our enemy. Starfleet wouldn't exist. Hell, the Federation wouldn't exist."

responses.text: "Anyone who's willing to serve is welcome on my ship."
"What's your opinion of the Federation in this timeline?"
"There are some species that will never be part of my crew."

screens.text: "I wish your temporally displaced colleagues felt the same."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You won a war I never had to fight, against shapeshifters who infiltrated every level of Starfleet. Frankly, it's made you all a little paranoid."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You're more than a citizen of Earth, or a member of humanity. You're one of many beings who share this galaxy. Whether we're enemies or friends, there's something to be learned from all of them."

responses.text: "I look forward to whatever I learn next."
"Your service record indicates you weren't always so enlightened."
"Like which ones to avoid...."

screens.text: "Age can do that to a man. Age, and loss."

responses.text: Continue

description: The temporal crisis has brought new conflict to the already fractious Klingon Empire, where vengeance, deceit, and rebellion are the least of a captains worries. Respond to these distress calls before the Empire falls further into disorder.

intro.text: "We thought the Kriosians had finally accepted our rule, but a group of rebels has stolen a K't'inga Battlecruiser. They're planning an attack on the Klingon High Council to demand independence. If you see these traitors, bring them to justice."

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

intro.text: "That imposter in the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance has dishonored us both! The Regent disguised himself as me to steal the Defiant. A trophy for his fleet, as if wearing my face was not insult enough. The Defiant belongs with Starfleet, Captain, with a proper commander."

"The so-called High Council may have made a deal with the Federation, but I've signed no such treaty. There can be no peace between our people, Captain, only one fallen, and one victor. The first Federation colony I find will see that."

"There's been a warp core breach aboard the IKS Hegh'ta. The crew have evacuated, but their ship is still adrift, and its automated defenses are still firing. It gets closer to the H'atoria colony every minute. If we can't destroy it soon, the explosion will wipe out the entire colony."

"One of my officers was fool enough to buy new disruptor rifles from a Ferengi. Every single one has a burned-out induction coil. If my men catch up to him, we'll have a dead Ferengi and a diplomatic incident on our hands. Perhaps you could have a word with the trader instead?"

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

description: Aid the crew of the Discovery in matters both personal and professional, close to home and light years away.

intro.text: "I know now isn't a great time to provoke the Romulans, but they've just dropped a whole mess of warbirds outside the Xahean homeworld. We have to protect them, they have... people, and buildings, and things. Totally average things. Still worth protecting."

quests.name: The Price of Friendship
quests.description: The Xaheans possess something of incalculable value: a dilithium incubator. Can you protect both this technology and the Xaheans from being exploited?

intro.text: "Okay, so I do know why the Romulans would want to invade. I'm kind of friends with the Xahean queen, who invented a dilithium incubator, just for kicks. That kind of brilliance... it has to be protected. Some Romulans made it to the surface and we have to stop them."

"The Discovery--or one of them--just dropped out of warp outside Alcor IV, and appears to be readying to bombard the planet. There's no one onboard, at least no one detectable via sensor, and the ship isn't responding to hails. Disable its weapons, now."

quests.name: Zora's Invitation
quests.description: A mysterious woman named Zora has invited you to board the otherwise empty Discovery. Seek her out and learn of the crew's fate.

intro.text: "You really wanted to get my attention, didn't you? Well, you have it. Come aboard and show me what else you've got."

quests.name: Starved for Attention
quests.description: Saru fears his village--which is pre-warp and unaware of Starfleet's existance--is suffering through a famine. Discreetly investigate the situation.

intro.text: "My people know nothing of starships or transporters. I've been unable to contact them since I joined Starfleet, though I've kept up to date on studies of my homeworld. The latest ones are disturbing. They suggest my people are starving."

"At my own expense, I arranged for a drop of food rations for my village. My people will see it as a 'gift' from above. But I've lost contact with the transport crew, in an area known to be frequented by Ferengi pirates. Please, Captain... my people are starving."

"A Galaxy-class starship was stolen from spacedock, and your vessel is closest to its last position. Comm chatter indicates the theft was executed by Nausicaan pirates... but I have my doubts. Disable the ship so we can find out who we're really up against."

quests.name: Mudd's Enterprise
quests.description: The criminal Harry Mudd has been caught trying to steal a Galaxy-class starship. Can your away team apprehend him before he escapes the disabled ship?

intro.text: "Well, well, Captain. You've gotten this far, but smarter, bolder, better-looking officers than you have gotten farther. Let's see who gets off this ship with their prize first, eh?"

quests.name: The Wrong Crowd
quests.description: An adult version of Worf's son Alexander has joined the Augments! Repel them from the House of Martok on Worf's behalf.

intro.text: "The Augments are attacking the House of Martokwith aid from my son, Alexander. I require assistance to stop these petaQ without causing permanent damage to my son."

challenges.name: Beam into Hand to Hand Combat

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

intro.text: "I am a man now and free to make my own choices. I've chosen the Augments. Respect my decision, or die in battle!"

screens.text: "That was my sonyet it was not my son. Alexander has the heart of a warrior, but not the skill. Yet the man I saw felled many foes with ease."

responses.text: "Perhaps the Augments have taught him a few things."
"I'm not surprised. Warrior or not, he's still part Klingon."
"He is part humanwe aren't as hopeless as you think!"

screens.text: "False praise does not serve my son, especially in this dishonorable alliance he has formed with the Augments."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "These are Alexander's failings alone. Or were his failingsthey seem to have vanished, now."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I fear the Augments have altered Alexander in some wayperhaps through genetic enhancements or other illegal practices. We must take him into custody somehow, if we are to learn the truth."

responses.text: "Alexander's brought shame to your house and the Empire. He will be stopped."
"Let's not accuse the Augments without proof. They can be honorable too."

responses.paraphrase: Remind Worf Alexander is an adult.
responses.text: "I'll help you, but consider thismaybe Alexander's better off this way...."

quests.name: The Prodigal Son
quests.description: Worf must meet face to face with Alexander in order to learn the truth of his son's new alliance. Enter an Augment colony and find him!

intro.text: "I believe my son Alexander to be living in an Augment colony. We will find him, and he will be made to answer for his crimes...."

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

screens.text: "So it is true. The Augments have changed you. But it is a false strength. No true Klingon would ever betray his own people!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Yes, it seems it is trueeven as a great warrior, I'll never be the son you want me to be. Well, I have a place with the Augments nowand I'm not about to give it up!"

responses.text: "You don't have a choice. These enhancements are illegal, and will be undone."

responses.paraphrase: Order Alexander to fight for Klingons.
responses.text: "A true warrior may keep his strength... if he uses it for the Klingons."
"If you've really found peace with the Augments, then you're free to go to them."

screens.text: "No! This was my choice! You can't do this to me!" It takes many men to restrain and lead away the genetically enhanced Klingon.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: Father and son share a tense gaze. "That seems an acceptable compromise. Perhaps you'll look better on me now, Father."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: The younger Klingon looks shocked, but nods gratefully. "Goodbye, then, Father. Maybe we'll meet on the battlefield someday."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I have failed Alexander in many ways. But to willingly accept genetic enhancement... this is my burden, not yours. Thank you for helping me learn the truth."

responses.text: "May he bring no more shame upon you, the House of Martok, or the Empire."
"The Augments listened to Alexander and what he wanted. Maybe you should try it."

responses.paraphrase: Express satisfaction for job well done.
responses.text: "As long as things are more stable in this region as a result, I'm happy to help."

quests.name: Assault and Battery
quests.description: Augment forces have kidnapped a version of Data. Board their ship and rescue the famed android Starfleet officer!

intro.text: "This is a distress call being sent to all known Starfleet frequencies via my neural network. I have been captured by the Augments and require immediate extractionby force, if necessary."

challenges.name: Disable Intruder Alert and Sneak In

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

screens.text: "Thank you for your prompt assistance, Captain. While not equal to my molybdenum-cobalt alloy frame or positronic brain, the Augments do possess superior strength and intellect in comparison to other humans, and in force were able to overwhelm me."

responses.text: "Do you know why the Augments tried to kidnap you, Commander?"
"Did you send a distress call to the Klingons as well?"
"Yet more evidence we should legalize genetic enhancement."

screens.text: "I am not familiar with Klingon subspace communication frequencies. Unfortunate, as I am certain a joint rescue would have done much for Federation-Klingon relations."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "There does seem to be a wide range of opinions on the subject. I sometimes wonder if my emotion chip could be classified as genetic enhancement. But I digress...."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "While I was in their custody, the Augments questioned me on the research of my creator, Doctor Noonian Soong, as well as his current whereabouts. I am concerned their ultimate goal is to take Doctor Soong into custody. I advise we take steps to prevent this."

responses.text: "I don't know what the Augments are planning, but it has to be stopped."
"Let's assume nothing. The Augments often utilize violent means for noble ends."
"It would be my honor to assist you and your creator, Commander."

intro.text: "We know you have been tracking our ships. Any child could see it. Whatever it is you're after, Starfleet, it's ourslike everything else, someday."

quests.name: A Father Figure
quests.description: The Augments plan to capture Doctor Noonian Soong, Data's creator, for reasons unknown. Reach him before the Augments do!

intro.text: "We have ascertained Doctor Soong's possible location. I have provided the coordinates to your crewplease extract Doctor Soong safely before the Augments reach him."

challenges.name: Rig Stasis Field to Stabilize Soong

screens.text: "We will die fighting if we have to, Starfleet. You will not harm Arik Soong, or interfere with his work!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Let's not lose our heads. No one's indicated they wanted to harm me or interfere with my work. I'm simply trying to get a head start on my great relative's research."

responses.text: "You kidnapped Data to study androids?"
"Sounds like you want to cheat, to me."
"I have every intention of arresting you."

screens.text: "I tried his brother, Lore, first, but he proved... unstable. I gave Data every chance to come willingly."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Noonian would never have created his androids without my early work on what would become the positronic brain. Why shouldn't he return the favor?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Arik helped us when no one else would. When I say I will die for him, I mean it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I believe I can resolve this situation without further bloodshed. I will remain with Arik Soong and allow him to study me."

responses.text: "What if he tries to deactivate or disassemble you?"
"It's your choice, of course... but are you sure?"
"Like hell you will! After all we did to save you?"

screens.text: "I don't yet regard Data, Lore, or any other androids with as much affection as my descendant. But you have my word, he will be treated with dignity and respect."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I do not understand your objection. A rescue attempt was necessary and valid based on the information we possessed at the time. We have since received new information."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "There are many versions of me in this universe. I do not believe I am doing Starfleet a disservice, and I may even learn more about my own existence in the process."

responses.text: "I'm interested to see what Augments might do with androids."
"I can't say I approve, but again, it's your decision."
"Absolutely not. Arik Soong is going in the brig."

quests.name: Pillage and Plunder
quests.description: The Augments have raided the temporally restored House of Duras and kidnapped B'Etor! Help her sister Lursa stop them.

intro.text: "Starfleet! You claim to be friends of my people? Then help me stop these Augments from escaping with my sister, B'Etor, in chains!"

challenges.name: Stalk Augments and Ambush at Shuttle

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

intro.text: "We Klingons believe in the right to vengeance. But Lursa has positioned her ship in orbit of Qo'noS, and her wild attempts to stop her sister's flight threaten civilian transports. You must act!"

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

screens.text: "The House of Duras has never suffered such a blow. I will see each and every one of these Augment creatures torn limb from limb until I find B'Etor!"

responses.text: "The Augments go too far, attacking unprovoked. It is without honor."
"No offense, but what possible use is B'Etor to the Augments?"
"Aren't you supposed to be dead?"

screens.text: "You see things the Klingon way. I hope you do not shy from blood either, for there will be much of it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We are the finest female specimens the Klingon race has to offer. Surely you can see the value in that for such people."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I have heard the account of my supposed future death. Pah! As if I would league with this Soran, or allow Starfleet to get the best of me!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I will find my sister B'Etor and I will have revenge on these honorless dogs. You can join in the battle, or stay out of my way."

responses.text: "Of course I'll join you. The Augments will pay for this treachery!"
"I want to hear the Augments' side of this story first."
"Starfleet officers do not engage in vendettas. But I'll help find her, at least."

quests.name: Double Trouble
quests.description: You have located B'Etor, kidnapped by the Augments. She is surprisingly unguarded, and does not look pleased to see you....

intro.text: "I stand with my Augment brothers, the future of the Klingon Empire! Die with Lursa if you like, StarfleetI won't hold back!"

screens.text: "You choose Starfleet as your ally? The Klingon Empire has become even weaker than I thought!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "This Starfleet is different, and will not look away when I spill your traitorous entrails on the ground!"

responses.text: "Anyone who turns their back on their own people deserves death."
"B'Etor has the right to join the Augments. You don't have the right to kill her."
"You lied to me, Lursa. You're both in Starfleet custody now."

screens.text: The Klingon woman bares her teeth in a grin. "True words. I will not dishonor your ship by spilling her blood here."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Treachery abounds in this timeline, I see. I will have vengeance on you both, then, someday!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Klingon Empire is full of cold hearts like my sister's. The Augments are true warriors, and will conquer even the Federation someday!"

responses.text: "You're the one with the cold heart, B'Etor. Leave my ship immediately."
"There won't be any need for conquering. I support the Augments."
"The Federation will never fall, not as long as I'm a Starfleet captain."

quests.name: Stolen Honor
quests.description: Augment agents have robbed the Klingon Empire of valuable cultural artifacts. Gowron has requested your assistance in their return.

intro.text: "Greetings, Starfleet. The Augments once again meddle in the affairs of the Klingon Empire. The petaQ have stolen relics of our great Emperor Kahless. I can pay handsomely for their return."

screens.text: "Well done, Starfleet! You have stripped the Augments of their prize and restored the honor of the Emperor with your actions. These artifacts will be returned to Kahless by my own hand. This I swear."

responses.text: "It was my honor to protect these treasures and see them returned intact."
"This is an odd play for the Augments. Stealing things?"
"What's your interest here, Gowron? Why are you speaking for the Emperor?"

screens.text: "You have my gratitude, and just reward."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Do not underestimate them. I am certain this was only the first step towards a far more nefarious purpose."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I made no such claim. I want what is best for the Empire. Do not question how I serve it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: Moments after Gowron's ship departs, a transmission comes across Federation channels. "Captain! Do not allow Gowron to take the relics of Kahless."

responses.text: "He has already left, relics in hand. What's this about?"
"Impeccable timing, T'Pol. He's gone."
"How do you know about this meeting? Explain yourself."

screens.text: "I will never understand the human propensity for sarcasm in times of great urgency."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "With multiple versions of myself in this universe, I have chosen to make myself available as an independent agent to the Federation. I have been monitoring Gowron's communications and drew the obvious conclusions."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Gowron supplied the Augments with the means to steal these relics and used you to cover his tracks. Those relics were trophies Kahless claimed from the defeat of Molor. This theft corresponds closely to the upcoming festival of Kot'baval, which celebrates the defeat of Molor."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Why steal symbols of a vanquished tyrant before the ritual reenactment of his defeat? He wishes to make a statement. I believe Gowron intends to slay the Emperor and usurp the throne during the celebration. It could spark a Klingon holy war."

responses.text: "I could see it, especially if this Gowron's heard about his future."
"Gowron is ambitious, even as a young man, but this seems unlikely."
"That scheming cur! I'll see him answer for everything he's done."

screens.text: "Descending into mental instability followed by defeat in a duel against a much younger Klingon does seem an ignoble end."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I didn't inform you of Gowron's plans to set a new assassination plan into motion. Our first priority must be to protect Kahless."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You should not act based on my information alone. We must gather additional proof so that when the time comes, we can present both Vulcan and Starfleet-supported evidence against Gowron."

responses.text: Continue

quests.name: Behind Closed Doors
quests.description: The Vulcan T'Pol has accused Gowron of being in league with the Augments and plotting to usurp Emperor Kahless. Find proof of this, if you can.

intro.text: "Klingon technological security has not come very far since my time. There is undoubtedly evidence of Gowron's guilt in the databanks of his house."

challenges.name: Sneak into the House of Gowron

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

intro.text: "It seems that Gowron has found proof of something toothat I am the one who informed you of his plans. His men are attacking my shuttle, which has limited defensive capabilities. I require immediate assistance."

quests.name: Right of Conquest
quests.description: Gowron has escaped with the artifacts of Kahless and plans to use them in a risky bid to usurp the throne. He must be stopped.

intro.text: "Emperor Kahless himself will participate in a re-enactment of the defeat of his ancient nemesis. That is when Gowron will strike, but I fear forewarning Kahless will only escalate a conflict. We must chose our moment carefully."

screens.text: "You! You Federation dogs! You have always sought my downfall! You always knew I was the greatest threat the most fit to rule! You knew I would not serve your every whim, so you stole my rule."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "This time I could have overcome my fate and surpassed my legacy. By what right do you rob me of this?"

responses.text: "We are the allies of the Klingon Empire. We will not stand by as you threaten it."
"The right of conquest. The vanquished are owed nothing."
"I don't appreciate being used. If you'd confided in me, it wouldn't end this way."

screens.text: "Pah! Empty, honeyed lies! Flatters and cowards, the lot of you!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You don't have the spine to finish me in real combat!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I will never trust the Federation! You were convenient, as were the Augments. Nothing more!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "What will it be next, Starfleet? Give me a blade and we'll finish this, or are there other insults have you prepared for me now?"

responses.text: "Your crimes aren't against me. Your people will decide what to do with you."
"I won't give you the honor of a warrior's death, Gowron. You can rot."

responses.paraphrase: Tell Gowron to run to Augments.
responses.text: "I suggest you seek asylum with the Augments. You have no place here."

screens.text: "There are few in Starfleet I regard as true warriors. But you, Captain, are one of them. I would gladly have you by our side in this offensive we hope will crush Khan and his Augment petaQ."

responses.text: "I've been waiting for this day a long time. What is our objective?"
"There is honor in peace as well, Martok."
"Even together, this won't be easy. Are you prepared to die?"

screens.text: "But no honor in Khan or his ilk. They would wipe us from the face of the galaxy, and the Federation too. There is no alternative, I assure you."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I have fought countless battles, Captain, and been prepared to die in all of them. To die in this one might be the greatest honor of all."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Augments have a research facility where they practice their foul 'enhancements.' The machines, the tools, the patientseverything is there. We're going to burn it to the ground. Are you with us?"

responses.text: "We'll toast our victory over the ashes. Qapla'!"
"If there is truly no other way, I'll commit my crew."
"Let's hope we're not biting off more than we can chew..."

quests.name: Cleansing Fire
quests.description: Martok is leading a Klingon assault on the Augments' main research facility. Join him and his warriors in glorious combat!

intro.text: "Today will see the end of these science experiments. The Federation will be cleansed and the Empire victorious. To battle!"

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

screens.text: The Klingon leader stands over several captured Augment researchers. "And now the final blow. We kill these survivors so that these crimes of nature can never be repeated!"

responses.text: "Allow me. Away team, set phasers to kill."
"Ending illegal genetic enhancement is one thing. Murder is another!"
"I'm stepping away. Whatever remains when I return is your business."

screens.text: "Yes. This honor should be yours." The Klingon leader nods in satisfaction as your crew executes the Augment survivors.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: Several of the Klingons cry out in protest, but Martok lifts his hand to silence them. "Out of respect for you and the Federation, I will take these creatures alive instead." His men lead the Augments away.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: You see the Klingon leader roll his eyes before you look away. After the sound of weapon fire, you look back and the Augment researchers are gone.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "For the second time, this insidious idea of genetic perfection and the Augment creatures who champion it have been defeated. This time, the Klingon Empire has had the honor. May word of our deeds spread throughout this sector. Qapla'!"

responses.text: "Qapla', indeed! To great nations, and great warriors."
"I don't take pride in violence. But I'm glad to have resolved this dispute."
"May the Federation and the Klingon Empire enjoy continued friendship."

screens.text: "At first, I thought you must be one of us. Your decisions so swift, your attacks so deadly. But you are merely a paragon of Starfleetthe perfect choice to help us against the Klingons."

responses.text: "I believe you are far greater warriors. Tell me the plan."
"I suppose a more peaceful resolution is out of the question?"
"Only if you promise me genetic enhancement afterwards."

screens.text: "You assume too much, my friend. My resolution can be as peaceful as the Klingons like."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: The Augment leader laughs. "From you to the Federation and the entire galaxy beyond, I hope."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Klingons are a stubborn people. I must meet the High Council face to face if I am to convince them there can be peace between us. We will take them captivewith as little force as possibleand then see what can be done."

responses.text: "A worthy quarry. I will aid your forces in reaching the High Council."
"Very well. But I get the feeling you aren't telling me everything...."
"Stubborn and violent. I look forward to knocking a few foreheads together."

quests.name: By Hook Or By Crook
quests.description: Khan Noonien Singh plans to capture several members of the Klingon High Council and force them to come to an accord. Help the Augments succeed!

intro.text: "Houses, High Councils, codes of honor... all useless trappings. We will force the Klingons to accept peace. Join us, my friend."

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

screens.text: "If the Augments are greater warriors, so be it. But that is not their plan, Captainthey want to revive the Augment virus and make us twisted monsters like them!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Change is progress. If the neanderthals of Earth had refused to ever pick up a tool or live in a community, where would we be now? This is for the good of your Empire, Martokthe good of all Klingons."

responses.text: "Your Klingon physiology will either adapt or die. A true test of strength."
"I never agreed to this! I won't let you spread the Augment virus, Khan."
"My part in this is done. You have your captivesdo what you like with them."

screens.text: "You soft human petaQ" The Klingon roars obscenities at you as the Augments take him and the rest of the Council away.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I misjudged you, thenlike the rest of humanity, you clearly need more time to mature." He signals for the Klingons to be returned to Qo'noS.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You should claim your victories, Captainnot hide them like the mistakes of a child." But he signals for the Augments to lead the Klingons away.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Our superiority over the Klingons is clear enough, but by having invaded the heart of their Empire and striking at the Council itself, the lesser beings of the galaxy can have no more doubt."

responses.text: "I look forward to the day when there are no more lesser beings."
"There is strength in a controlled hand as well, Khanremember that."
"Great. Now, about, that genetic enhancement for me...."

quests.name: Under New Management
quests.description: Bajoran crew members have taken Deep Space Nine by force. Retake the station and restore order!

stages.text: Find Inside Help to Lure Bajorans
Defeat Bajorans to Free Deep Space Nine
