quests.name: The Vedek's Trail
quests.description: Teero Anaydis is the prime suspect behind an otherwise inexplicable Bajoran mutiny, but the trail has gone cold. Pick it up and find him!

quests.name: The Mad Vedek
quests.description: You've found Teero Anaydis's hideout. An army of mind-controlled Bajorans and Maquis stand between you.

intro.text: "Lieutenant Torres's attempt to stop you from reaching Teero shows how serious this situation is. Now that you've reached his hideout, you may take any and all necessary measures to apprehend him."
intro.response: Enter Hideout and Arrest Teero Anaydis

screens.text: "Pagh t'em far, B'tanay. I understand. Pagh t'em far, B'tanay. I understand...."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We'll make sure Lieutenant Torres and others affected by Teero's brainwashing get help. We've held Teero here as long as we can, but I'm told you'll be taking him to the proper authorities. Where do you plan to go?"

responses.text: "He'll go to Bajor. The Prophets will judge him for what he's done."
"He'll go to the Maquis. Teero was Maquis oncethey should handle this internally."
"With all due respect, Captain Sisko, I'll keep that information to myself."

screens.text: Sisko nods approvingly. "My own bias aside, public sentencing from the Bajorans will also improve the damaged relations between Bajor and Cardassia. This is the best decision for stabilizing this region."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: Sisko frowns. "I don't have much faith in Maquis justicethey didn't do a damn thing to stop Teero on their own. But I've been told this is your decision, and you've made it, so that's the end of the matter."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I suppose I don't blame you. I've heard of officers from different times in their lives becoming turncoats, clones or versions of officers from alternate universes impersonating the real ones. In these times, there may be no one we can truly trust."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Until the Bajorans and the Maquis can come to an accord on Cardassia, this region of space will be dangerous. But no Bajoran need fear being forced into that conflict against their will. The Prophets are smiling on you for that."

responses.text: "I'm honored to have served the Bajoran people, Emissary."
"I hope to see both sides make reparations to the Cardassians."
"The Maquis have the right to fight for their homes. Hopefully I can help."

quests.name: Manna from Heaven
quests.description: Major Kira's first relief effort is helping a Cardassian colony on the brink of starvation. Beam down to provide food and medical aid.

intro.text: "There's a Cardassian colony on the brink of starvation. No one deserves to die like that, and helping them could make things better for all of us. Will you come?"

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

screens.text: "I knowI'm the last person you expected to be helping the Cardassians. But if there really is peace in this time, that's an incredible thing. I want to make sure the Maquis and the Bajoran resistance don't ruin it."

responses.text: "I applaud your efforts. What can I do to help?"
"So no vengeance? No desire for revenge?"
"Not fighting is one thing. Helping is another."

screens.text: "The Dominion War almost completely destroyed the Cardassian Union. It seems like they've gotten back what they did to my people ten times over."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I don't know about you and Starfleet, but I joined the Bajoran militia because I was tired of fighting. Why not do whatever we can to make sure we never fight again?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm working with Cardassian authorities to organize a large-scale relief organization, headed by both Bajorans and Cardassians. Until that becomes a reality, we need all the supplies, personnel, and commitments we can get."

responses.text: "Whatever you need, I'll make sure you have it."
"Watch your back. The Cardassians might have other motives."
"If I help, it's only to make sure this is a fair fight."

intro.text: "The Maquis have blockaded a Cardassian colony. There's no military forces here, just innocent civilians. I'm tied up elsewhere, but you've got to break this blockade!"

screens.text: "I couldn't leave without saying goodbye. You've done so much for me, the Maquis, the Cardassians, the Bajorans... but mostly me."

responses.text: "What do you mean? What did faking a relief effort do for you?"
"I knew Major Kira would never lead a Cardassian relief effort."
"Who are you? Why are you dressed so differently?"

screens.text: "Oh, I don't know, maybe she would. Ask her, if you ever find her. Lucky for me she's still lost out there, somewhere."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "In my universe, I'm a highly-placed official in the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance. But I'm not a fan of what they've done in this universeI think I could do better on my own."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm sorry to cut this conversation short, but I've got to be on my way. I think the Maquis and the Bajoran resistance will make a fine starting army for me to accomplish my personal goalsonce they see Major Kira returned to the fold."

responses.text: "You're not going anywhere. Set a pursuit course!"
"I admire your tenacity, but this is personal now...."
"It's going to take all my self-control not to destroy your ship!"

intro.text: "This ship may be small, but I've outfitted it with several Alliance enhancements I think you'll find interesting. Assuming you're still going to try and stop me, that is."

screens.text: "For a minute there, I thought you were about to destroy my ship. It was exhilarating. In my universe, everyone's depressed, fighting an endless war... this one is so much more fun!"

responses.text: "If you liked this, you're going to love Cardassian prison."
"The Bajorans don't think so. They'll decide your fate.."
"I'm going to let you go to the Maquis... but as the Intendant."

screens.text: "I know how to handle the Cardassians, Captain. Haven't I been doing it for years?" She laughs as your crew leads her away.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I look forward to confessing all my sins to the Prophets." She laughs as your crew leads her away.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "If you think I can't win them over this way too, just watch me." She laughs as your crew leads her away.

responses.text: Continue

quests.name: Rescue the Val Jean
quests.description: The Val JeanChakotay's Maquis raideris caught in a plasma storm. Help them escape!

intro.text: "A Captain Janeway claims you can free my ship from this plasma storm. Be warned, we'd rather die here than go to a Federation prison...."
intro.response: Enter Plasma Storm to Save the Val Jean

stages.text: Convince or Force Maquis to Accept Help
Move Val Jean to Safe Position

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

challenges.name: Use Storm Energy to Free Val Jean
Convince Val Jean to Free You

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

screens.text: "So much for gratitude. Like the rest of the Maquis who've reappeared in this timeline, the Val Jean is taking up their cause against the Cardassiansand they're not above appropriating Bajoran resources to do it."

responses.text: "Do we know where the Val Jean is headed now?"
"I support the Maquis cause. I don't see the issue here."
"This must be strange, coming from a time when you're friends."

screens.text: "Do you support the theft of goods and personnel from the Bajoran people, a Federation ally? If so, we may have a problem."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Chakotay was a different man when he was in the Maquis, and I was a different woman before we left the Alpha Quadrant. I didn't expect us to be friends in every universe."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We need to track the Val Jean, stop whatever 'borrowing' they plan to do from the Bajorans, and ideally convince them to leave the Cardassians in peace."

responses.text: "Anything to improve Bajoran-Federation relations."
"Chakotay is a good man. I'm sure he'll see reason."
"With the Bajorans' help, we'll crush the Maquis yet."

quests.name: Maquis Incitement
quests.description: The crew of the Val Jean plans to fire a Bajoran weapon at a Bajoran target to incite war! Can you stop them?

intro.text: "News of a manhunt travels fast. We've learned Chakotay and his Maquis are planning to fire a Bajoran weapon at a Bajoran targetthen blame it on the Cardassians! They must be stopped."
intro.response: Go to Weapon Bunker and Stop Maquis

stages.text: Locate Weapon Maquis Intend to Fire
Get the Maquis to Abandon Plan

intro.text: "We were hoping to keep this whole incident quiet, but the Cardassians have been listening in. They're demanding we hand over Chakotay and his crew, and they've brought a cruiser to do it by force. The Cardassians would torture them or worsewe have to stand firm."

screens.text: "Neither Starfleet or the Bajoran government lifted a finger to help us against the Cardassians in our own time. Seems nothing's changed. I'm done talking."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "After that conversation, I'm not sure how we became friends in any universe. What do you suggest we do with Chakotay and his crew?"

responses.text: "Lock them up. The Maquis are criminals, period."
"Technically they never got to commit a crime. Set them free."
"Their actions threatened the Bajorans. Let the Bajorans decide."

screens.text: "I don't know if I'd go that far. Most of them proved to be loyal, dependable officers. It's too bad the temporal anomalies haven't brought them here as well."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm going on record as strongly opposing that decision. But you know the state of the galaxy in this time better than I do."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Very well. But let's hope the Maquis don't take advantage of the situation to reopen old wounds between the Bajorans and the Cardassians."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm impressed, Captain. You didn't let what you knew of Chakotay and his crew affect how you resolved this situation. It's no wonder Starfleet's trusted you with the fallout of this temporal crisis."

responses.text: "Coming from you, that's a humbling compliment."
"I only hope I haven't crippled the Maquis entirely."
"The Bajorans are that much safer from insurgent influence."

quests.name: Off at the Pass
quests.description: Shakaar wants to prove the Maquis and Bajoran resistance are a force for good. Help by convincing a rioting colony not to attack the Cardassians.

intro.text: "Together the Maquis and the Bajoran resistance have caused a lot of chaos, but I think we can do a lot of good, too. Starting with heading a fight off at the pass, with your assistance...."

ship.name: Maquis Raider
ship.flavor: A small and manueverable ship, favored by the Maquis for quick escapes and durability under hostile pursuit.

ship.name: Maquis Raider
ship.flavor: A small and manueverable ship, favored by the Maquis for quick escapes and durability under hostile pursuit.

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

screens.text: "I want to hit the Cardassians as hard as anyone else, but those colonists have never even picked up a phaserthey would have gotten themselves killed. I don't want this revolution to just be about destroying the Cardassians. I want to win a new future for Bajor."

responses.text: "Bajor was doing fine until you people showed up."
"I approve. Bajor has been the underdog for too long."
"How do the Maquis feel about less fighting?"

screens.text: "I want more than fine. I want to make sure we can never be dominated again, by the Cardassians or anyone else."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "There's more resistance thereunsurprising, considering in the present, they were completely wiped out by the Cardassians. But change comes one person at a time."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Having Starfleet defend our reputation would mean a lot. I hope I can count on you to promote the Maquis and Bajoran resistance movement as good for the region."

responses.text: "If you're sincere, I'll support you."
"I don't trust you. I'll wait and see."
"Whatever's good for the regionwhether you're lying or not."

screens.text: "I have no doubt Shakaar is sincere, perhaps one or two others. But you and I both know that on the whole, the revived Maquis and Bajoran resistance want nothing more than to see my people ground into space dust."

responses.text: "Even if that's true, I think Shakaar can change them."
"I agree completely. This was a farce from the start."
"Let's assume you're right. What's your point?"

screens.text: "And if you're wrong? What if all these good feelings, all this trust, only lead to betrayals and doublecrosses and death?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Your work hasn't been pointless. You've laid a good foundation for us to reveal the Maquis and Bajoran resistance for what they really are."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Whether Shakaar's movement can change or not, it's better for the region if they go back into extinction where they belong. I propose we make that happenby sabotaging the next photo op."

responses.text: "Done. I'll look for an opportunity."
"No. The collateral damage isn't acceptable to me."
"No. I believe in what Shakaar is doing."

quests.name: Internal Dispute
quests.description: A fight has broken out between Bajorans and Maquis during what was supposed to be a simple exchange of supplies. Help prevent further bloodshed!

intro.text: "Quickly, Captaina fight's broken out between Bajoran and Maquis forces. I don't know what happened, but we've got to stop it before word gets out, or lives are lost."

screens.text: "This was supposed to be a simple mission of mercy. Instead, someone set a fire, and then fanned the flames into an inferno. Should I suspect the Cardassians, or did they have help from Starfleet?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'll confess to setting the fire. I'll let my friend speak to the fanning."

responses.text: "Yes, I'm responsible. This is what's best for the region."
"How could you accuse me, after all I've done to help?"
"I had nothing to do with this. I believe in what you're doing, Shakaar."

screens.text: "I can only hope you'll be in another universe by the time this dispute's resolved." The Bajoran angrily closes the comm channel.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "How could I not, seeing the company you keep?" The Bajoran angrily closes the comm channel.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "That remains to be seen." The Bajoran angrily closes the comm channel.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I couldn't be sure you'd do this by yourself. But I promise, the final denoument is in your hands. What will you say of the Maquis and Bajoran resistance now?"

responses.text: "I'll cover up this debacle. Peace is the only way forward."
"I'll expose this bloodbath. Their movement must die."
"I'll leave it in your hands. I'd rather not know what happens."

intro.text: "We're in pursuit of Michael Eddington, a former Starfleet officer turned Maquis leader turned madman. We have to overtake him before he harms himself or others."

screens.text: "It's been some time, Captain. I want to thank you again for your assistance with Eddingtonand ask for your help once more. Upon capture, Eddington was sent to the Cardassians, who had said they could cure him. We've heard nothing since."

responses.text: "What do you think happened to Eddington?"
"Sending him to the Cardassians was your first mistake."
"Let's not jump to conclusions. These things take time."

screens.text: "I'm not a man who draws conclusions before he has all the facts. And I intend to get the facts."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Cardassians of this time want only peace. Their offer was seen as a gesture of goodwill... perhaps we were naive to think that's all it was."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Not this much time. Not with all the resources Cardassia has, especially in matters of the mind."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Cardassians have agreed to a controlled meeting with Eddington on their terms. They claim too much stimulation could trigger a relapse, and seeing me would go particularly badly. I'm hoping you'll go in my place."

responses.text: "The Maquis need Eddington. I'll do whatever I can to help."
"I'll do this, but only to clear the Cardassians."
"Eddington deserves his health, even if he is a Maquis."

quests.name: Cardassian Hospitality
quests.description: The Cardassians claim you can meet the healed Michael Eddington for yourself, but Odo is suspicious. Verify Eddington's identity and report back!

intro.text: "As a Maquis, Eddington was a daring, often ruthless leader who baited Captain Sisko at every turn. An illness might bend him, but not break. Make sure it's the same man we know."

challenges.name: Hack Tricorder to Model Brain Waves

quests.name: Temporary Hold
quests.description: Michael Eddington is being held by the Cardassians, who claim to be curing his mental instability. Infiltrate their facility to learn the truth.

intro.text: "Michael Eddington is being held at a location the Cardassians tell me doesn't exist. They're up to something, and we need Eddington to find out what."

screens.text: "Not this time, Javert. You won't tell me what's real and what's not. Not you or your band of spoon-head jackals!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Our treatments have clearly had some unintended side effects... but we can restore Eddington to sanity. A sanity that will end all this unpleasantness between Bajorans, Maquis, and Cardassians."

responses.text: "By making sure the Cardassians win, I assume?"
"So you were behind Eddington's insanity all along?"
"Your name sounds familiar, for all the wrong reasons...."

screens.text: "You say that as if the Maquis and the Bajorans aren't trying to do the same thing. Our methods don't involve killing anyonejust taking control of one man."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Insanity was never the goal. We captured Eddington with the intention of removing his hostile tendencies towards our people. But our initial treatments obviously did not work, necessitating a second session... once you got him back for us."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Bajorans, the Maquis, and I suppose the Federation would call me a war criminal. What you all forget is that while my research may have unpleasant beginnings, it is eventually used to save many lives."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Eddington is no great friend of mine or Starfleetbut no man deserves this. I'm told you have authority in these matters. What should be done about him and Moset?"

responses.text: "Return Eddington to the Maquis. He should be with his own."
"Send Eddington to a Starfleet facility. At least they'll try to help him."
"Give the Cardassians one last chance to helpwithout Moset."

quests.name: Picking the Bones
quests.description: Doctor McCoy is onboard a Maquis transport fleeing its Bajoran pursuers. Can you help them escape?

intro.text: "I found myself on a Maquis ship and went to work helping their injured. But we're being pursued by a trigger-happy Bajoran ship, and we''ll be space debris soon unless you stop them!"

stages.text: Put Space Between Maquis and Bajorans

screens.text: "In my day, the Federation protected its people. Can you make sense of these Maquis being branded criminals and our Bajoran allies firing on them? Because I can't!"

responses.text: "The Maquis are terrorists. They'll stop at nothing to win."
"The Bajorans were in the wrong to attack without provocation."
"How did you end up on a Maquis transport, Doctor?"

screens.text: "Maybe in their first life. The band I'm with just wants their homes back, and almost died fighting for them."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "This is my first encounter with the Bajorans, and I'm not impressed. Even when we ran into the Klingons or the Romulans, we still hailed them first!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Your guess is as good as mine. One minute I'm in sickbay on the Enterprise, the next I'm on some freighter, surrounded by phaser-burned men and women."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Maquis tell me they were just trying to pick up supplies when the Bajoran authorities confiscated them and tried to arrest them. These people won't survive without them."

responses.text: "I'll do what I can. The Maquis need all the help they can get."
"The Bajorans must have had a good reason. I'll find answers."
"Just remember, Doctorthere's likely more to this story...."

quests.name: Pretense of Mercy
quests.description: Doctor McCoy has asked you to recover supplies for the Maquis wounded. But were they rightfully confiscated?

intro.text: "Here's the coordinates where the Maquis say their medical supplies are being illegally held. I hope you have more patience with these Bajorans than I would."

stages.text: Proceed with Plan or Vy for Replacements

intro.text: "Wait, so they were weapons, not medical supplies? That explains this pirate ship attacking us! I've half a mind to let this ship go down in flames... but I'd rather die among friends. Save the Maquis ship so I can get the hell off!"

screens.text: "I've seen everything from the removal of a man's brain to his possession by an alien species, but this takes the cake. The Maquis lied to me. Former Starfleet officers lied to me!"

responses.text: "These are different times. I'm afraid Starfleet isn't as clean as it once was."
"The Maquis have been driven to desperate measures by the Federation's indifference."
"I tried to warn you. The Bajorans know the Maquis well, and were in the right here."

screens.text: "Then it's up to me, damn it. Me and all the other Starfleet officers who remember what being one used to mean!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm a doctor, not a revolutionary. If the Maquis want to keep up this pointless fight, they'll do it without me."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Seems I've got a lot to learn about the twenty-fourth century. I'm only grateful no one got hurt."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "They tell me you're in charge around here, until they've got a way to get me back to the Enterprise. Give me your orders, and I'll follow them."

responses.text: "Go to Bajor. The Bajoran people could use your good, common sense."
"Stay with the Maquis. Save lives, no matter your personal politics."
"Get to the nearest starbase. Starfleet needs Bones back in the ranks."

screens.text: "The Prophets are surely testing us with these temporal anomalies. But they have also provided the means of our salvationa Bajoran and Cardassian in one."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Kai Winn is referring to Seskaa Cardassian operative who was altered to infiltrate the Maquis as a Bajoran. We've rescued a version of her, and enlisted her to manuever the Maquis into a trap."

responses.text: "A bold move. Where do my crew and I come in?"
"Haven't the Maquis heard of Seska? For that matter, haven't you?"
"What's so important about having a Bajoran and a Cardassian involved?"

screens.text: "Only Commander Chakotay's crew were familiar with her, and any Maquis versions of them in this timeline won't know of her betrayal yet. Working with her is risky, but we believe the payoff is worth it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Do not discount the power of symbols. This will show both the Bajorans and the Cardassians that we are at peace now, and can unite against a common enemy like the Maquis."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Seska's going to lead the Maquis to believe they are abducting a version of Gul Dukat. When they're in position, she'll signal you, and your crew will help arrest all Maquis present."

responses.text: "Understood. We'll await Seska's signal."
"I only hope our trust is not unbelievably misplaced...."
"I have faith that the Prophets will see this plan through."

quests.name: The Toss
quests.description: Cardassian-turned-Bajoran Maquis Seska has the Maquis's best in position. It's time to spring the trap and capture them for the Bajorans!

intro.text: "Seska, yet another Bajoran horribly scarred by the Cardassians here. Ready to trap some Maquis terrorists when you are, Captain."

stages.text: Even the Odds or Attack Immediately

ship.name: Maquis Raider
ship.flavor: A small and manueverable ship, favored by the Maquis for quick escapes and durability under hostile pursuit.

challenges.name: Try to Incapacitate Bulk of Forces

ship.name: Maquis Raider
ship.flavor: A small and manueverable ship, favored by the Maquis for quick escapes and durability under hostile pursuit.

screens.text: "You do know me being Bajoran was a disguise, right? Why wouldn't I try to turn what's best for them into what's best for Cardassia?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "What's best for you, you mean. And you may have tried, but you failed. Nearly all Maquis are now in Bajoran custody, awaiting punishment."

responses.text: "The Maquis nearly started another war. They should all be jailed for life."
"I think Seska deserves worse. At least the Maquis had good intentions."
"Returning Seska to the Cardassians might further goodwill in the region."

screens.text: "That will be up to their Bajoran prosecutors. But I'll certainly recommend it." He signals security personnel to lead Seska away.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: The Cardassian woman laughs. "And they led right where they always do, don't they?" Starfleet security personnel lead her away.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: Sisko looks surprised, but nods. "I can't deny the logic in that. Much as I think its like returning a snake to its nest." He signals security personnel to lead Seska away.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I cannot thank you enough for what you've done. Even the Cardassians are praising our leadership in resolving this dispute. The will of the Prophets will be felt throughout this region for a long time to come."

responses.text: "I am only the Prophets' servant, like everyone else."
"This region will benefit from the wisdom and leadership of the Bajoran people."
"Take care not to get too caught up in the Prophets' will, Kai Winn...."

screens.text: "Being a leader in the Cardassian Union is much more palatable without the Dominionbut the reborn Maquis and Bajoran resistance are a serious threat that needs to be neutralized."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Starfleet agrees. I've learned my duplicate, Thomas, joined the Maquis later in life and even impersonated me at one point. I intend now to return the favor."

responses.text: "What will impersonating Thomas accomplish?"
"Is there no way for all these factions to co-exist?"
"I'm in. These movements should have stayed dead."

screens.text: "You've seen us co-existing so far. This dispute is the result."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The movements, not the people. A distinction I hope our Cardassian friends remember."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "If you cut the head off a snake, it dies. The Maquis have rebuilt themselves far too fastthey must have a high-placed leader somewhere in Starfleet. Commander Riker will infiltrate the Maquis as Thomas, learn this leader's identity, and help us capture him, or her."

responses.text: "My crew and I are ready to assist, Commander."
"As long as this doesn't end in a fatal 'accident'...."
"I look forward to seeing both movements crushed."

quests.name: A New Recruit
quests.description: If the Maquis leader is discovered and captured, their movement will fall apart and the Cardassians will win the dispute. Help Riker find the leader!

intro.text: "I've been undercover before, but never as an alternate of myself. Hopefully most of the Maquis don't know Thomas wellbut their leader will want to meet him."

ship.flavor: A small and manueverable ship, favored by the Maquis for quick escapes and durability under hostile pursuit.

screens.text: "You really think capturing me will stop the Maquis or the Bajoran resistance? I'm not that important. The cause is so much bigger than me."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You had everyone behind you, men like Captain Picard, and what did you do? Threw it all away to become the leader of a terrorist organization."

responses.text: "I'm as disgusted as you are. Take her away."
"Let's not make it personal. We won, Ro lost."
"You've become what you despise. I hope you realize that."

screens.text: The Bajoran rolls her eyes. "You're disappointed in me? Believe me, I'll sit up nights crying about that one." Your crew leads her to the brig.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I don't care what happens to me. As long as the Cardassians lose." Your crew leads her to the brig.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You're wrong. I'm not a Cardassian." Your crew leads her to the brig.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Her defiance is pointless. Without her resources and connections in Starfleet, the Maquis and the Bajoran resistance will fall apart. You've ensured the survival of the Cardassian Union and the end of this dispute."

responses.text: "May this lead to a stronger alliance between our peoples"
"Don't abuse your new influence in this region."
"I'm just glad to be moving on from this old argument."

screens.text: "Surprised? Don't be. There's no way the Maquis could have come back so strong in this chaos without inside help from Starfleet. And now, with your help, we have a chance to finally claim this region for ourselves."

responses.text: "I'm glad there's someone else in Starfleet who thinks like me. Tell me the plan."
"I understand claiming Cardassian space, but what about the Bajorans?"
"Revenge on the Cardassians is more important than claiming Maquis space to me."

screens.text: Another Bajoran enters. "The resistance has been reborn too. Not all Bajorans support us, but after we pull this off, I'm confident they'll see the light."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "They're one and the same to a Cardassian. They lost practically everything to the Dominion. What do you think it'll do to them to lose the rest?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "With their current leader gone, the Cardassians have allowed a version of Gul Dukat to claim power. No man has caused the Maquis or the Bajorans more pain. We're going to capture him and make sure he can never give another order again."

responses.text: "Just let me know where to be. The Maquis will have my full support."
"Remember what Dukat is. We're no better than him if we indulge in bloodlust...."
"I'd rather make sure he never takes another breath. But that's later...."

quests.name: Man With a Plan
quests.description: Join the Maquis in a daring plot to board Gul Dukat's personal ship and capture the infamous Cardassian!

intro.text: "We've got Dukat in our sights. There's no way he can outrun us. I don't care how you get on board or how you get Dukatjust get him."

screens.text: "Brave little children. How do you think this is going to end? You don't really think a Starfleet officer is going to let anything happen to me, do you?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Shut up. I don't care what time you're fromyou're going to pay for everything you've done to my people, and everything you would have done to the Maquis."

responses.text: "Do whatever you want to himI just can't be a witness."
"I'm sorry, I can't let you murder him. We can guard his cell together."
"The best punishment is to make him work for you."

screens.text: "Not a problem." The Bajoran resistance leader takes the shocked Cardassian away to be executed by the Maquis.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: The Bajoran resistance leader scoffs, saying to Ro, "I told you Starfleet didn't truly believe in the cause." He leads Dukat away to be imprisoned.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: The Bajoran grins. "Good thought. You'll go back to your desk, Dukatbut you won't do anything without feeling a Maquis phaser at your back." Shakaar leads Dukat away.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Dominion already left the Cardassians crippled. Once they hear about Dukat, and the Bajorans see true justice is possible, the Maquis will get all the support they need in this region. If it isn't obvious, I appreciate your help."

responses.text: "I'm just glad the Maquis are finally getting a second chance."
"Don't leave Starfleet. We need you here as much as the Maquis...."
"I hope this satisfies your need for revenge. Look towards rebuilding."

description: Q has volunteered to assist the Federation during this temporal crisis, but can he be trusted? Join legendary Starfleet captains of the past to seek help from other powerful beings.

screens.text: "We have the cooperation of perhaps the most powerful being known to Starfleet. But Q's never been much for altruismhow do we know he doesn't have some ulterior motive?"

responses.text: "What could that motive possibly be?"
"Because he stands to lose as much as we do."
"One? I'm sure he's got several."

screens.text: "I don't know. And that's the most dangerous place to be when it comes to Q."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "How do we know that? Because he told us so? He isn't on the same playing field as the rest of us. Why would the rules be the same for him?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We've never encountered a being as powerful as Q, but there are several who have come close. I want to know why we haven't heard from themdon't you?"

responses.text: "I'm just taking this one crisis at a time, Captain."
"Perhaps they're incapacitated in some way."
"I don't think we should annoy Q by doubting him."

screens.text: "We find the right help, and we might be able to resolve them all at once."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Perhaps they want to help, but can't. Perhaps they're the reason for this whole mess in the first place. We'll never know if we don't find them."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "If Q is sincere about helping us, then it wouldn't do him any good to punish us. If he thinks less of us afterwards, we're probably no worse off in his eyes than before."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I want you to start with the Caretaker. Don't worryI don't expect you to go all the way to the Delta Quadrant. We've determined his array has been transported to Omicron Theta. He claimed he would have helped us if he could. I think we should take him up on that offer."

responses.text: "Thank you for the lead. I'll head to Omicron Theta immediately."
"I'm willing to give Q the benefit of the doubt, but I suppose you outrank me."
"If Q asks where I am, make up something convincing...."

intro.text: "This is Ocampa space now. The Caretaker is off-limits to anyone but my people. We don't want to fight you, but we will if we have to."

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

screens.text: "My people have no quarrel with youonly with the Caretaker. You don't want his help, he'll only destroy you like he did us!"

responses.text: "What on Ocampa are you talking about?"
"Who are you? Who are your people, for that matter?"
"I assume you're referring to the destruction of your homeworld."

screens.text: "My name is Kes. My people are the Ocampa, and we lost our homeworld when the Caretaker burned our crops and dried up our oceans. We had to live underground for years."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You say that like it's nothing! Imagine if you lost Earth. Your green things dead, your water dried up, your home just a lifeless husk...."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We called him the Caretaker because we thought he took care of us. We thought he saved our species from a devastating natural disaster. Now we find that he caused the disaster, and then pretended to be our savior! We won't let him do it again, to anyone else."

responses.text: "So you're going to keep him locked up on his array forever?"
"How did you find out about this? Starfleet records indicate the Caretaker died..."
"What revenge could you possibly take on such a powerful being?"

screens.text: "...before he could tell us? Yes, we've heard. He died, and only then admitted his crimes, when it was too late for him to make amends."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I never said we wanted revenge. We want him to atone."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Caretaker has chosen to stay here with us. He's promised to help the Ocampa make a new home here in the Alpha Quadrant before he dies. Every moment he has left must be dedicated to that purposehe cannot help you."

responses.text: "If that's the Caretaker's choice, then I must respect it."
"The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few. You Ocampa are the few."
"You could have done that without firing on my ship...."

screens.text: "Thank you. I knew you would, if I came to you in Kes's form. I'm told she achieved great things with StarfleetI can only hope to see her do the same here before I die."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "But they are my few. I knew even addressing you as an Ocampa, you would never understand. Please, leave."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Ocampa are devoted to me. I apologize for their overzealousnessand my deception in presenting myself as Kes. I wish you peace, and luck."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I have the undesirable distinction of having had more run-ins with Q than any other captain in Starfleet. Whatever his motives, we do not want to leave our fate entirely in his hands."

responses.text: "I struck out with the Caretaker. Do you have another suggestion?"
"And you're not biased at all, I suppose?"
"Do you have any theories on what Q might be up to, Captain?"

screens.text: "On the contrary. Q has had an incredible impact on my life, one I don't wish to have erased. Even so, that doesn't make him trustworthy."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I've learned better than to theorize when it comes to Q. This may all be another of his infamous tests for humanity, or something else entirely."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Q likes to think he's a god among men, but I've met many gods in my career, and not all of them are so self-absorbed. The Cytherians come to mindan advanced race capable of increasing the intelligence of lesser beings and interested in making peaceful first contact."

responses.text: "How do you suggest I approach the Cytherians?"
"Can you tell me more about your interactions with them?"
"Benevolence and efficiency are not the same thing."

screens.text: "The Cytherians endowed a member of my crew with the advanced intelligence needed to get the Enterprise to their location. A roundabout method of initiating first contact, but an effective one."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I don't expect anyone to solve our problems for us. But it would be useful to have a true ally in this chaos."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Cytherian homeworld cannot be found on any star chart, nor reached at any warp. It was necessary to initiate a subspace distortion in order to reach them. I am transmitting all we know about Lieutenant Barclay's methodsproceed with care."

responses.text: "We'll make contact with the Cytherians as soon as we are able."
"I hope my ship survives this bold, possibly suicidal move...."
"If Q comes looking for me, maybe ask if he wants to catch up."

quests.name: Cytherian Highway
quests.description: To reach the Cytherian homeworld, you must intiate a controlled subspace distortionwithout destroying your ship in the process!

intro.text: 'Take care, Captain. The Cytherians gave us more information on subspace distortions, but the procedure has never been attempted outside of a simulation, and the Enterprise did not emerge unscathed from Barclay's actions.'

stages.text: Develop AI to Manage Subspace Burst

challenges.name: Create Subspace Ship Network for AI
Create Positron Matrix to House AI

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

screens.text: "A new face... human... only one. Have we found our way at last?"

responses.text: "I'm a Starfleet officer, come to ask for your help."
"Why do you look like Captain Picard?"
"Found your way? Are you lost?"

screens.text: "Help... yes, we need help...."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Jean-Luc Picard... the last human we saw... you are human... what are we?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We are trying to get home. We cannot find our home. Without home, we do not know where we are. Home? Or lost?"

responses.text: "You're lost because of the temporal anomaly crisis. We all are."
"You seem ill, or perhaps injured. Do you have healers?"
"You're home... I think. One of these planets must be real."

screens.text: "Then we must look to you, human... you are our only anchor, for now."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Speaking with you is a tonic, human. You are the first fixed point we have seen in some time."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "There is no reasoning to your assumption, but it is a comfort to think so."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You say anomalies have disrupted time and space. We will attempt to find and dissipate these anomalies... but we cannot predict the results."

responses.text: "Let's remain optimistic. Mind over matter may be the difference here."
"We asked for your help. We won't hold you responsible if things go bad."
"Red alert! To your stations, be ready for anything...."

quests.name: A Singular Occurrence
quests.description: The Cytherians will try and repair the timelines via a controlled singularity. Monitor their progress and react quickly if anything goes wrong.

intro.text: "A singularity, created and properly controlled, may force the timelines to perform a self-correction. We will attempt this. You will know very soon if we fail...."

screens.text: "So many Cytherians, lost to us now... how could we save them, when we do not know even where we are?"

responses.text: "You took casualties in this attempt?"
"What kind of help was that? You nearly destroyed my ship!"
"This is our fault. We never should have imposed on you."

screens.text: "Perhaps not casualties... but these beings are truly lost now. We do not know if they will ever find their way home."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We were willing actors. The fault is equally distributed."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We first brought your species to us not out of sloth, but because our physicality is symbionic with our home. Without it, we are rudderless, unable to act as we intend. We will be of no use to you in resolving this temporal crisis."

responses.text: "I understand. Thank you for making the attempt anyway...."
"This is our second strike. I'm beginning to lose hope...."
"Don't do that again. Don't do anything, in fact, until we sort this out...."

screens.text: "We've made first contact with countless species, and it hasn't always gone so well. But in most instances, we've come to a place of greater understanding because of it. I don't think the answers are with people who already think like we do."

responses.text: "I'm willing to try anything at this point. What are you proposing?"
"If nothing else, I might get a good fight out of it."
"You're suggesting we ask a hostile group of superbeings for help?"

screens.text: "You say that like you expect me to agree. I hope my legacy hasn't been reduced to a few fistfights."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We should reduce their hostility first, but yes."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I know you haven't heard of the Organians, because I'm the only Starfleet captain who's ever come in contact with them and been allowed to remember it. They're extremely advanced, noncorporealSpock said they are to us as we are to an amoeba."

responses.text: "Such advanced beings might indeed know more about this crisis than we do."
"What was the nature of your interaction with the Organians?"
"I still think we should trust Qhe hasn't steered us wrong yet."

screens.text: "Exactly. They might even know how to solve it, in short order."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "They allowed the Klingons to occupy their world, and we attempted to liberate them. They single-handedly ended the war between us."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I never met this Q, but Starfleet records don't indicate he's much for steering. He might trust the wind, but I don't."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I know I'm several decades behind here, but there's something to be said for aged wisdom. What have you got to lose?"

responses.text: "Nothing. We'll set course for the Organian system."
"Everything. I hope this doesn't make things worse...."
"If Q comes calling, try not to deck him."

screens.text: "Humanity. Starfleet. We remember you, even in our current primitive, physical state. Leaveyour endless thoughts and feelings are tiresome to endure."

responses.text: "So this isn't your prime timeline form, but a past incarnation?"
"You helped us end a devastating war once. We were hoping you'd help us again."
"Do none of you think we can handle seeing an alien?"

screens.text: "We will eventually evolve beyond a physical form, beyond pain and pleasure alike. For now, we remain bound to physical bodies. Any bodies, but bound all the same."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "As if I would have chosen this diminutive female form. I inhabited this Hoshi Sato onceI appear doomed to inhabit her forever."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We hail from a time before we were freed of the physical cage. Everything is a burden to us in this formlight, sound, sensation, thought. These anomalies, the paradoxes in time and space... it is excruciating."

responses.text: "Then you stand to gain much by helping us."
"You can perceive temporal anomalies on a physical level?"
"It hasn't exactly been a picnic for the Federation either."

screens.text: "A realization we came upon ourselves long ago, thank you."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Can't you? Sad that your species has achieved so little since our last encounter."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Do not compare your petty politics to our deep, enduring trauma."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The only way we might assist you is through our heightened perception. We can feel where the universe has been deeply wounded. But seeking out these locations would involve immeasurable, possibly fatal pain. That is not a price we are willing to pay."

responses.text: "Have you ever heard the saying, 'The needs of the many...."
"Then let's negotiate, and come to a more agreeable price...."
"You assume we plan to give you a choice...."

quests.name: Organian Aid
quests.description: The Organians possess the unique ability to detect rifts in the spacetime continuum. Convince them the reward will be worth the physical cost.

intro.text: 'You claim to value all forms of life, but you want to find pain by listening to us scream. Your canaries do not fare well, human. We refuse to serve such an equally base purpose.

challenges.name: Show Results of Inaction in Holodeck

intro.text: "We have agreed to help you, Captain, butah! Another lesser species is attempting to destroy your ship. Defeat these Romulans, before the pain and fear they have brought overwhelms us...."

screens.text: "Stop! The Earth, you humans... we can bear no more! Please, leave this system!"

responses.text: "You're in unbearable pain when near Earth?"
"I can't, not until you tell me what this means."
"I feel fine. Are you sure this isn't all in your heads?"

screens.text: "Un... unbearable, yes. It began in this system, worsened near your homeworld."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "This is your epicenter, human... a place where the very fabric of time and space has been forcibly torn apart."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "These feelings... these sensations... they are so base to us, we would never use them in a lie."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You have your answer, human. If you seek the beginning and the end of these anomalies, look amongst your own. Now please... take us home!"

responses.text: "A deal is a deal. We'll set course for Organia immediately."
"I'm sorry we put you through this. The cost was too high."
"You're too useful. We're putting you in Starfleet custody."

screens.text: "We will tell future generations of this. For your sake, we hope they do not seek vengeance."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "No! Your children will pay for this, human. And your children's children...."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Not to detract from humanity's accomplishments, but I find it hard to believe we could have done anything to trigger such a galactic catastrophe. Still, the Organians' proof is damning."

responses.text: "We're capable of any feat, big or small."
"We may not be the epicenter, but something's clearly off."
"Perhaps we should ask Q."

screens.text: "Under these circumstances, I'm not sure that's a comfort."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Perhaps we should. I'm not sure what his hailing frequency is, myself."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I have all my own seniority plus that of my future self as an admiral. I'll get to the bottom of this no matter how much red tape I have to tear through. You should return to the fieldI'll contact you when I know more."

responses.text: Continue

quests.name: Ishka Issues
quests.description: Nog's grandmother, Ishka, has been kidnapped by a band of Kazon! Help Nog rescue her before she comes to harm.

intro.text: "It's my grandmother, she's been kidnapped by the Kazon! There's no doubt this is Brunt's doing and he's going to demand my father's surrender, or worse. The Kazon aren't known for showing courtesy to prisoners, but especially not female ones. We have to save Moogie!"

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

intro.text: "Oh, boy, incoming, Captainlooks like the Kazon aren't giving up Moogie without a fight. They know she's on your ship, and now they're after you!"

screens.text: "That was amazing, Captain! Those thugs never stood a chance. It doesn't really add up to me, though. How were they able to get so close to the ruling family, and why not go after my father if they made it that far?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You meddle in affairs that are none of your concern, Starfleet! That woman dared to believe she had the privilage to command me. I meant only to show her her place, but after this insult I swear there will be blood between us."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "That was Jal Haron! He suppose to be working for my father...! Ugh, these Kazon are so infuriating. At least the Klingons have a code of honor!"

responses.text: "Will the Alliance be alright without those mercenaries on their side?"
"Don't worry, a little latinum should improve his mood once he calms down a bit."
"Your father has chosen some dangerous allies, Nog."

screens.text: "I'm not so sure. I think he's fighting for pride more than anything my father's paying, and we just wounded it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I think maybe father hopes they'll learn the way we did. He's a bit... naive sometimes."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Kazon are even more backward than the Traditionalists, but my father does need them. They're the only people eager to go to war with other Kazon. There's got to be a way to help us get along with them. The Federation could help keep the peace, right?"

responses.text: "I can't promise to take sides in a war. I'll settle this misunderstanding though."
"The Alliance has a lot to offer the Kazon, they just don't see it yet."
"You're better off finding new help, but I'll mediate if need be."

intro.text: "Does Grand Nagus Rom think I care about the terms of my contract? Respect cannot be bought, only earnedand I will earn it by taking a few Ferengi ears!"

quests.name: Common Ground
quests.description: Jal Haron has returned to demand surrender from the Ferengi Alliance for their crimes against him. Help mend diplomatic relations between them.

intro.text: "I have not forgotten what you've done to me. Now that you face the full might of Relora are you still so eager to insult me? Surrender and beg! It will be your only hope for survival!"

screens.text: "These Ferengi are spineless worms... but they live in opulence even the First Maje of Relora can admire. I will observe them as you suggest. If we share their prosperity, I'll permit them to live."

responses.text: "You'll find that many species who've embraced peace are similarly well off."
"The Ferengi will test your patience, but they know to compensate accordingly."
"Keep your quarrels with the other sects and we'll all be happier."

screens.text: "Yes, Federation. I've seen the peace you keep. I'll decide for myself."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "At least they have the sense to offer tribute to their betters."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Only Jal Culluh is fool enough to oppose Relora, and I am always pleased to remind him of his feeble position."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Don't think this means we're friends, Starfleet. Anyone who has technology as advanced as yours but so often chooses talk over conquest is not to be trusted."

responses.text: "I hope you'll understand my reasons in time."
"The Federation doesn't have to be your enemy. Remember that."
"If I have to fight you again, I may not be nearly as quick to offer kind words."

quests.name: Deadly Disruptions
quests.description: Theives have stolen a fortune from Quark, including an old stash of Klingon disruptors. Recover them before they fall into the wrong hands.

intro.text: "I've been robbed. Cleaned out. Every last asset I had tucked away including a stash of Klingon disruptors I was holding for my cousin. We can't have that sort of thing in the hands of unscrupulous thieves, can we? So I thought my good friends at Starfleet might want to know."

ship.name: Ferengi D'Kora Marauder
ship.flavor: An enigmatic vessel used for battle and transport. Capable of disabling a deflector shield.

screens.text: "You know, I remember when the Federation had the courtesy to knock before a visit. Care to explain why you're barging in and turning my operation upside down?"

responses.text: "I was investigating a robbery. I didn't expect to find you here."
"It looks more like you're going to war than running a business."
"I'll make it up to you, Quark, but first I need an explanation."

screens.text: "There's nothing here that doesn't have every right to be. If anyone's the victim here, I am."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Business is war, friend. And lately the fighting has been intense."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'll hold you to that, Captain, but I don't know that there's much to explain. I'm just holding onto what's mine."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Ever since this temporal anomaly nonsense started, someone has had it out for me. Going after assets not even my idiot brother knows about. It's gotten so bad that I had to hire these gentlemen to protect my interests. Now they're siccing the Federation on me too?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "This is his doing somehow, isn't it? My idiot brother, I mean. He's still sore I laughed when he told me he's the head of the Alliance. Rom, Grand Nagus? We'd all be broke in a day! He must have suffered a blow to the head."

responses.text: "I hate to tell you, but you were the one who sent me. Some version of you anyway."
"You can't even share with yourself? You really are a model Ferengi."
"You may find settling things with violence self-destructive in this case."

screens.text: "You're suggesting I'm the one responsible? No wonder the rat knows all my tricks... Say, you aren't going to let me get the better of us like that, are you? How about you help me secure my assets and settle this once and for all?"

responses.text: "It's clear you're both going to need some help sorting this out."
"One of you is going to pay for the trouble. I promise you that."
"I'd say it's a personal matter, but I don't need you two creating a paradox."

quests.name: Self Control
quests.description: Quark's future and past selves seem unwilling of resolving their differences without outside assistance. Act as arbitrator in their dispute.

intro.text: "Stealing my livelihood, smearing my good name, dressing like a savage I've got nothing to say to that fraud!"

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter

intro.text: "This is awkward, Captainboth our hired Kazon crews don't understand that victory doesn't have to come with blood. My crew's firing on the imposter's ship, and his is responding in kind. We could use a middleman."

screens.text: "I don't see why we're even debating the issue anymore. I have deeds for all of those properties, signed Quark clear as day. And as the humans say 'possession is nine tenths of the law."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Just because you've got a natural talent for forging my signature doesn't mean anything. I'm an upstanding member of the Ferengi Alliance and you're... a reminder of some bad life choices."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Let's let bygones be bygones, and hurry up with being gone. Captain, can we please skip to the part where you rule in my favor? I'd love to put all this behind me and with him it should come naturally."

responses.text: "Sorry, but he quite literally precedes all your claims. I'm ruling in his favor."
"It's clear that he's trying to steal your identity. Arrest the fraud."
"Let's resolve natural laws, before trade ones. Place them both in custody."

screens.text: "If it's any consolation, I'll be leaving it all to you when I'm gone."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "What? That's preposterous. I was me before he ever was!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "This is Ferengi space, you've got no right to hold me!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "There's no sense arguing. We agreed to accept the captain's judgement and a deal's a deal."

responses.text: "Consider it a temporary settlement until the anomaly is resolved."
"You can count on the Federation to enforce this resolution."
"If you could have reached a compromise, it wouldn't have come to this."

intro.text: "Doctor Reyga, a Ferengi scientist from the Alliance, just confirmed that the Traditionalist faction has armed their Kazon mercenaries with weapons of mass destruction. I can assure you, we won't have long before they use them. Will you assist our pursuit?"

screens.text: "This isn't my first time thwarting Jal Culluh's aggressions, but I don't think Voyager could have stopped him alone. Those isolytic torpedoes are capable of tearing a hole in subspace. We were only fortunate that Kazon ingenuity doesn't match their enthusiam."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "That may not be a blessing. Isolytic burst weapons are highly reactive to warp energy they require careful handling and your sensor scans indicate a dangerous instability in the Kazon's warp drive."

responses.text: "We have to reestablish contact and deescalate the situation."
"What are the implications of a full-scale reaction, doctor?"
"So it's entirely possible that this all sorts itself out as nature intended."

screens.text: "The Kazon are notoriously stubborn. It'll be no simple task to convince Jal Culluh to see reason."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Our best case would be a combined detonation of the munitions and warp core. More likely, a subspace rupture large enough to consume the entire sector."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Subspace tears are rarely a natural phenomena, but making one is much easier than fixing it. At the magnitude we're talking, I'm not sure if anyone ever could."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We've bought some time, but relocating Jal Culluh should be our top priority. We need to know what he's planning next and beat him to the punch. I recommend intercepting his communications and preparing gravimetric charges as a precaution against subspace tearing."

responses.text: "Culluh is a danger to everything in this sector. I won't rest until he's stopped."
"Distributing countermeasures against isolytic bursts might save the most lives."
"His employers likely got more than they bargained for, they might cooperate."

intro.text: "I'm sorry to say Jal Culluh is becoming more popular than the Grand Nagus. Several independant Ferengi captains admire him and put out a call for volunteers to hunt you down. Forwarding it along so you can, err, dispatch them."

quests.name: Trial by Fire
quests.description: Jal Culluh is en route to Ferenginar to bombard it with highly unstable weapons. Stop him before he destroys the planet, or worse!

intro.text: "I have wasted enough time with you, Starfleet. Soon you'll see what I'm truly capable of!"

challenges.name: Beam Away Team onto Culluh's Ship

screens.text: "You think this is over, Federation? It is not. When the Ferengi answer for their shoddy technology, I will rain destruction on you and Voyager both!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I recommend we tow those torpedoes aboard for safe disposal. I wouldn't mind knowing whose manufacturing banned technology while we're at it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Wait, a moment, Captain. The Alliance could use an edge against the Traditionalists and these torpedoes are more powerful than anything we've procured thus far. I believe I can modify them into a potent, but stable, conventional weapon. With your permission, of course."

responses.text: "I can't allow that, doctor. Those weapons are outlawed in most of galaxy."
"You may stabilize the weapons, but no need to let the Traditionalists know that."
"I could see that happening. If the Alliance provided the right incentive."

screens.text: "Subspace theory has come a long way since isolytic burst was first weaponized, but I understand."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "While I trust Reyga's expertese, I can't condone stoking the fire of a Ferengi arms race. I hope we don't come to regret this."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I see you're no stranger to us, Captain. I think something could be arranged."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "That's a decision for command to makeand I'll be going on record advising against it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "This wasn't an easy undertaking, but we saved billions of lives across the sector today. Let's hope that the next time we face Jal Culluh his weapon of choice will have less apocalyptic implications."

responses.text: "It doesn't matter, so long as we stop him from ever using it."
"Hopefully, it'll be easier to talk sense into the Traditionalists than him."
"Space-time is in bad enough shape without us blowing holes in it."

intro.text: "My idiot brothernot the Grand Nagus, the younger one who works for mehas taken his loyalty to the cause a little too far. He's leading a bunch of equally foolish traders to attack an Alliance ship. If you don't stop him, they'll all die."

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

screens.text: "I had that under control! My brother's just a worrywort. I think that older Nagus me is getting to him. We Traditionalists have got to stick together! That reminds me, I have some literature to send out...."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'd wonder if I was adopted, if the adoption market on Ferenginar hadn't crashed decades ago. I'm glad there's some version of Rom that respects tradition, but we need him like we need a third lobe."

responses.text: "The Alliance has done nothing to warrant such aggression."
"I think he's exactly what the Traditionalists deserve."
"He's your brother. Can't you reason with him?"

screens.text: "They've got themselves a Kazon sect too, don't they? But you're right, in this case."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "And if he'd succeeded in his plan, and knocked off a bunch of innocent Alliance traders, would that be what they deserved?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Rom's immune to reason. Common sense, too."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "My brother doesn't need to be locked up. He doesn't need to change sides. He just needs to go back to sweeping floors and serving drinks. Politics aren't his strong suitat least, not yet. Help me, and we all win."

responses.text: "For the Alliance's sake, I'll do what I can."
"The Traditionalists need strong leaders, not... Rom."
"I like you, Quark. For that reason alone, I'll help."

quests.name: For the People
quests.description: Rom has mismanaged a Traditionalist rally so badly that Ferengi are starting to wonder if they can run the Alliance. Get the rally back on track!

intro.text: "I swear, you can't turn your back on him for a second. Rom's holding a Traditionalist rally now, except he's mismanaged nearly every aspect of it and made us look like we don't know latinum from lettuce. We've got to fix this."

quests.name: With Friends Like These
quests.description: Rom must stop helping the Traditionalists. Staging an assassination attempt by Quark and an Alliance rescue should do the trick!

intro.text: "Now for the insurance. We double-cross Rom, make the Alliance come to his aid, and watch him become disillusioned with the Traditionalists entirely."

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

screens.text: "That dirty, double-crossing, no-good... that Nagus me is more of a brother than Quark's ever been! Maybe there's something to the new Alliance. I must have had a good reason to change my way of thinking, right?"

responses.text: "Oh, excellent reasons. You don't want to know the details."
"Don't let your family squabble get in the way of what's right."
"You're a good man, Rom. That's why you were named Nagus."

screens.text: "What did I ever do to him? Just because I'm Moogie's favorite...."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "But my son's with the Alliance... one version of him anyway... oh, I don't know what to do!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Yeah, I am pretty good, aren't I? Why else would Quark try to stop me?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You've been a friend to me, Captain. Tell me, what should I do?"

responses.text: "It's your destiny to lead the Ferengi into the twenty-fourth century."
"Show Quark who's really the Traditionalist here. Strike back!"
"Leave politics behind. I'm sure there's something broken somewhere."

screens.text: As you are brought before him, the Nagus stand expectantly. "Ahem." Your escort, hurridly pays your admission with a frown. "So glad you could make it, Captain. I'm pleased the Federation recognizes the true authority of Ferenginar."

responses.text: "You better recognize the value of our support."
"Let's forgo the pleasantries, Brunt. Why did you invite me here?"
"I'm not playing favorites. Only trying to resolve this conflict peacefully."

screens.text: "Never let good help get a better offer."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Straight to business. I like that."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Of course, of course. That's all I want as well. It pains me that so many good Ferengi have been twisted by a handful of warped individuals."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "It's time we take that idiot Rom and his misguided ideals out of the picture, before his family can set Ferengi business back any further. But we can't have him becoming some sort of martyr he's got to get dirty be proven a hypocrite. He's got to try to kill me."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm going to call a peace summit. Gather all the senior Ferengi in one place. Even Rom wouldn't be dumb enough to agree to that without an impartial party. So I'd like you to keep the peace... and turn a blind eye when the time comes."

responses.text: "So long as I can deny any involvement, you've got a deal."
"You truly are a snake, but at least nobody else has to get killed."
"I'll expect a very generous thank you after your acquisitions are final."

quests.name: Smiles and Knives
quests.description: Brunt has asked you help him frame Rom for an attempt on his life during peace talks. See that the plot succeeds.

intro.text: "I've paid a lot of latinum for an assassin to take a shot at me during this charade. See that he doesn't do his job too well and make sure that idiot Rom takes the blame. I've never been more happy for an attempt on my life."

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey

ship.name: Ferengi D'Kora Marauder
ship.flavor: An enigmatic vessel used for battle and transport. Capable of disabling a deflector shield.

screens.text: "You really had me fooled, Rom. Playing the naive rube, while you put one over on everyone. Letting females work. Collecting 'taxes'. It was all a scheme to line your own pockets and you almost killed the only one standing in your way. Admirable, if it weren't so... distasteful."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "That's I dont' Y-you're just making all that up! He's just making all that up! Tell them, Captain. Tell'em I had nothing to do with any of this!"

responses.text: "If you're innocent, Rom. I'm sure it'll be proven at your trial."
"Don't deny it, or at least try more convincingly. You're caught red-handed."
"You had a good run, Rom, but you were never cut out for politics."

screens.text: "Trial? You think I'm going to get a fair trial from him!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "B-but No! You've got to believe me! Captain...!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I... I want my Moogie..."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Very convincing, Captain. Once the extent of Rom's crimes come to light, there will be no question who should preside over Ferenginar."

responses.text: "I've found a few who are likely to challenge you. I'll share for the right price."
"All it took was a good and innocent man being locked away. Or worse."
"See about returning your territory to some semblance of order. It's all I ask."

screens.text: "Greetings on behalf of the Alliance. It's, uh, an honor to meet you. Nog's been singing your praises since you saved my Moogie."

responses.text: "The Federation is always happy to help keep order. What can I do for you?"
"Nog is a model cadet, so I take that as quite a compliment."
"How is your mother? Are the Kazon behaving?"

screens.text: "Takes after his father. Hehe, unconventional."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Oh, my Moogie's been through scarier kidnappings than that. Nnot to imply your rescue wasn't impressive... As it turns out Jal Haron loves Tongo. We're still working on how sore a loser he is."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You've done so much for us in this civil war, but the truth is... it could go on forever without help from the Federation. Power struggles are everyday business, but there's no profit in Ferengi fighting Ferengi. I think most of us know that, deep down."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Sure, some might be following Brunt because there's something in it for them, but I bet most are only on his side because they don't have any choice! So we take over Brunt's publicity network and offer asylum to any Ferengi that wants it. Good idea, right?"

responses.text: "Turn him into a king without a kingdom. It has merit."
"I'll support any way we can end this without more bloodshed."
"I'm skeptical, but you don't stand to lose much if you're wrong."

quests.name: Putting the Free in Freedom
quests.description: The Traditionalist's government media broadcast station spends most of its time condemning the Alliance. Help Rom get equal airtime for his rebuttle.

intro.text: "I'm, uh, a little nervous. I've been practicing... maybe I should have written it down. Ah, don't worry! Just get me on air and I'll know what to say!"

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.
