screens.text: "You've got a lot of nerve, Starfleet! Hijacking my communications and warping the minds of my people with treasonous prattle. You can bet the Federation's going to hear from me about this. You're going to pay for violating my sovereignty. I'll bleed you dry!"

responses.text: "You're a despot, Brunt, and the Federation doesn't recognize your authority."
"I think it's time to return to the negotiating table. Why gamble on your future?"
"They'll hear from me too. I'll recommend we suppress your rebellion by force."

screens.text: "My money is my authority and you'll find a lot of systems out there recognize it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You're trying to scare me into a truce, or maybe you think I'm bluffing? Shrewd, but I'll take my chances."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "If the enemy of my enemy is my friend. I'll be very popular."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You'll regret crossing me, Starfleet. You'll find the Ferengi aren't to be pushed around!" Brunt stabs his communicator with an angry thrust of his finger and the viewscreen winks out.

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Don't listen to him, Captain. This is the only answer you need." Rom holds up his datapad. Thousands of petitions for Asylum are flooding in to his office. "Pretty soon he's going to be very lonely."

responses.text: "It's reassuring to know we did the right thing."
"With his personality, I'm surprised it took this long to abandon ship."

quests.name: Quell the Riots
quests.description: Put a stop to riots incited by the Terra Prime movement. Rioting on this scale threatens the well-being of many human colonists.

intro.text: "The planetary separatist movement known as Terra Prime has reappeared, and is now inciting anti-Federation riots. We'll need your help with restoring order quickly... or the Federation will fall into chaos."

stages.text: Develop a Plan to Stop the Rioting

intro.text: "Not done yet, I'm afraid. A group of rather intrepid rioters managed to hijack a Federation training vessel. The vessel must be disabled before they figure out how photon torpedoes work."

screens.text: "On behalf of Section 31, I thank you for your help in stopping the riots. I've dealt with Terra Prime before, and they are as opposed to cooperating with aliens as ever. Earth will become ungovernable if their interference continues at this rate, and so will the Federation."

responses.text: "Why are you working for Section 31? Aren't they as dangerous as Terra Prime?"
"Is the situation really that serious?"
"Why don't we try to reason directly with the people of Earth?"

screens.text: "Threats like Terra Prime and the Terran Empire cannot be reasoned with. Section 31's purpose is to resolve threats of the kind these groups represent to the Federation's existence. With the government of Earth in complete disarray, Section 31 must take effective action."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "It can't get much worse. Communications networks are in a state of confusion, many leaders of the Federation are now missing... at this rate, Earth will cease to function as a Federation world in a matter of days. The better future I've worked for my whole life may soon vanish."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We have neither the time nor the resources to launch an effective counter-agitation campaign. All we can hope to achieve in the time available is to stop the instigators of these rebellions, before they can do too much damage."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We've learned that Ezri Tigan, from the 'Mirror' universe, is supporting the Terra Prime insurgents. If Terra Prime's followers link up with the Terran Empire, we'll have a revolution on our hands... and the end of Earth's involvement in the Federation. Please track her down."

responses.text: "I'll deal with Ezri Tigan however necessary to keep Earth in the Federation."
"I'll handle this delicate situation with respect for the Federation's principles."
"Don't grow too fond of my services. Section 31 must prove itself worthy of them."

intro.text: "So you've tracked me down. Don't expect stopping me will be as easy. I work for who I want, and today that's not Section 31!"

screens.text: "You've got no reason to trust me, but Emperor Spock seems to know what he's doing. Under his rule, the Terran Empire could be reformed into something that just might save what's left of your Federation... but that won't happen unless we get some help fighting off Section 31!"

responses.text: "You really believe that reforming the Terran Empire is possible?"
"You think you can defeat both the Federation and Section 31?"
"Isn't the only real solution a cease-fire?"

screens.text: "The Terran Empire's track record isn't pretty, and there's certainly no love lost between me and some of the resistance thugs they've taken in. But as long as Emperor Spock is calling the shots, I think it's more than possible."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Defeating the Federation won't be necessary. Section 31's already dug in so deep that they'll be running things in a matter of weeks. Spock's trying to change his empire. Section 31 just wants to control yours."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Like your shadowy Section 31 agents pay attention to treaties or cease fires. There won't be any peace with them until they're in tatters."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Terran Empire offers the Federation a future much brighter than whatever Section 31's got planned. I won't be going into your brig today, but you should think about that before we meet again."

responses.text: "I will consider Emperor Spock's initiative very carefully."
"I would prefer to see a total cessation of your subversive activities on Earth."
"That offer can go both ways. The Federation could use your help."

quests.name: Race to the Finish
quests.description: Section 31 agents have split ranks, and some believe Mirror Ezri Tigan must die! Help Malcolm Reed arrest her, for her own safety.

intro.text: "Mirror Ezri's split ranks in Section 31. I think she's far more valuable alive, but my colleages disagree. This time, we've got to capture her, if only for her own safety."

screens.text: "I respect what you're trying to do, Ezri, but Section 31 can't allow you to spread chaos throughout the Federationwe've got enough to deal with."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Right. You're too busy hiding the bodies, destroying the evidence... I've done some nasty things to get by, but even I don't get mixed up with shadow governments."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I was straight with youlet me go, and I'll keep trying to bring Section 31 down and the Terran Empire up. Or you can keep me locked up, and put your lives in the hands of this guy. What's it gonna be?"

responses.text: "I won't give you to Section 31, but I can't have riots. The Terran Empire can give you new direction."
"I believe in Section 31's guiding hand. They'll take it from here."
"I'm giving you a shuttle and a head start. Good luck."

quests.name: Blunting the Dagger
quests.description: Protect 'Mirror' Hoshi Sato's shuttle from attack by a Section 31 runabout full of assassins attempting trying to kill her.

intro.text: "I have information that could bring Section 31 down. I want protective asylum in the Federation, and a rescue from the Section 31 operatives trying to destroy my shuttle!"

screens.text: "I am being pursued by both operatives of Section 31, and those of the Terran Empire, for my role in diverting many Terran Empire secrets and equipment to the starship U.S.S. Chavez, which was later attacked by a Terran Empire warship. Those cargoes are vital to the Federation."

responses.text: "Why did you decide to defect to the Federation?"
"How were you able to contact the Chavez in the first place?"
"Why should I trust you?"

screens.text: "I've long had doubts about whether the Terran Empire was stable in the long run. I thought that no empire could grow so fast without employing methods of extreme brutality... but then I encountered the example of the Federation, and my mind was changed."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I knew their captain to be a good man, one that I could approach with my concerns about the current direction of the Terran Empire. When Terran agents discovered that I had joined the dissident factions, the Chavez responded to my distress call."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I realize that I come from a different world, Captain. There is nothing I can say that will gain your complete trust, but I have come to admire your Federation for living up to its promise of a better life for its citizens... plus the fact that my life is in danger."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "More hostile forces are headed this way, Captain. We won't have very much time to retrieve the data and equipment from the Chavez. We'll have to move, and soon. What is your answer?"

responses.text: "We'll provide assistance. The datafiles and equipment will be very useful."
"We'll provide assistance... for our own reasons."
"We must investigate our loss of contact with the Chavez. We're obliged to help."

intro.text: "Well, that didn't take long. A Terran Empire ship is blocking our way to the Chavez. You've got more firepower than I dobut I'll back you up, if I can."

quests.name: Salvage the Chavez
quests.description: Debris from your battle against the Terran Empire has rendered the Chavez unstable. Extricate the codes and weapon prototypes before it explodes!

intro.text: "Debris from that space battle hit the Chavezand its warp core has become unstable. We've got to get over there quick if we want our plunder."

ship.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ship.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

challenges.name: Reverse Tractor Beam to Repulse Ship
Repair Heavy Loader to Uncover Crate

ship.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

quests.name: Act of Betrayal
quests.description: 'Mirror' Hoshi Sato has betrayed you, taking the data from your ship's memory banks, sabotaging the ship, and escaping in a shuttle. Stop her!

intro.text: "Sorry, Captain, you've got your agenda, but I've got mine. Thanks for all of your assistance, but the Terran Empire will take things from here. Try not to choke on my exhaust."

ship.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ship.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

screens.text: "I realize I've deceived you and your crew. My career with the Terran Empire is over now that my mission has failed. I did my duty, but my superiors will no doubt declare me 'persona non grata'. What will become of me?"

responses.text: "What will happen to you if we turn you over?"
"Will you submit to criminal rehabilitation therapy?"
"Are we not stronger with you than without you?"

screens.text: "If I'm handed over to either Section 31 or my colleagues in the Terran Empire, I will face the death penalty for previous actions. One can rise to great heights in the Terran Empire, but falling from such heights after a failure of this kind is deadly."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Do I have a choice? 'Let us brainwash you, or we'll send you back to the people that want to execute you'? Interesting that the Federation is only comfortable with minds that it can control... but if my alternative is death, I'll put on a smile and accept your 'rehabilitation'."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Some in your universe have a saying, 'All it takes is knowing we're not going to kill...today.' I've always thought that was dangerously naive, but perhaps there is wisdom in it. We'll see how long I can suppress my instincts as I suffer through your rehabilitation program!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "What can I expect from Federation justice? What is your decision?"

responses.text: "Your decisions shape your fate. We'll turn you over to Section 31 operatives."
"Your people shall decide your fate. We'll turn you over to the Terran Empire."
"Most victims of the Terran Empire don't get a second chance. You shall. Join us."

quests.name: Control Over Chaos
quests.description: Rescue Smiley O'Brien from the planet surface before Terran Empire and Section 31 agents get to him first.

intro.text: "I'll be blunt. I'm being held captive by Section 31, making devices that could kill millions and allow them to take control of your Federation. Get me out of here, and I can tell you more."

challenges.name: Shadow Enemy Shuttle to Avoid Lock

screens.text: "I was captured by the Federation and put to work on a 'quantum nullifier' project to help starships travel faster, but that was a big lie. It's actually a Section 31 weapons project targeting 'mirror universe' individuals such as myself, and they intend to test it on me soon."

responses.text: "What does this 'quantum signature nullifier' do, exactly?"
"Which quantum signatures are considered 'safe' from this weapon?"
"Would this not be a way to restore order to the 'prime universe' timeline?"

screens.text: "It's pretty horrible. It uses a modified Genesis Wave to break down matter at the subatomic level which does not conform to the quantum signature of this universe. Anyone who doesn't belong in the present-day of this particular universe would be vaporized wherever this is used."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Only those which are related to your 'prime' universe, at the current place on the timeline. But there's nothing in the research that says the weapon couldn't also be directed against 'prime universe' signatures. Don't tell me your Section 31 jackals wouldn't consider that!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "That's a strange definition of 'order', since this weapon doesn't repair the timeline, it just destroys people and equipment showing up from other timelines. It's not going to stop them from coming, it just murders them after they get here."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Can I count on you to deliver me from the grasp of Section 31? I'd rather not be vaporized as a guinea pig in a secret Section 31 weapons test, if it's all the same to you."

responses.text: "We cannot condone further development of this weapon. We'll help you escape."
"I'm afraid not. This weapon may be the Federation's last chance for survival."
"It's impossible to put the genie back in the bottle, but we'll help you."

intro.text: "The Terran Empire just attacked the U.S.S. Shawnee, a research vessel. We don't want the Federation at large to know how serious of a threat the Terran Empire iswhich is why I want you to handle this."

screens.text: "You've just gotten a personal introduction to the brutality of the Terran Empire. They would crush the Federation if they get the chance. Doesn't it stand to reason that we should crush them first?"

responses.text: "I assume that's a veiled reference to your nullifier weapon?"
"If we're going to do that, you need Smiley O'Brien back."
"If we die, at least we'll die having stood for something."

screens.text: "I won't confirm or deny that assumption."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Or out of the picture. Either way, really."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Historians will decide what we stood for. And it's the people who live who get to write the history."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Smiley trusts you, because as far as he knows, you're not me. So I'm leaving him in your hands. I hope you make the right decision."

responses.text: "I'll make whatever decision is best for the Federation."
"For the glory of the Empire!"
"Whatever it is, you won't be part of it."

quests.name: Saving Smiley O'Brien
quests.description: Repel determined attacks by the Terran Empire, who wish to kill Smiley O'Brien for his role in developing Section 31's nullifier weapon.

intro.text: "Now the Terran Empire's after me! They know I helped create the nullifier, and now they want me dead. I've tried to tell them I hate Section 31 as much as they do, but they won't hear it. You've got to help me!"

stages.text: Defend Smiley O'Brien To The Last

intro.text: "I told you he trusted you. Thanks for keeping Smiley safe for us. Section 31 will take it from here."

screens.text: "I'm a man without a country now that the Terran Empire wants me dead. I don't know where I could go that I would ever be safe from both Section 31 and the Terran Empire. I hope you've got some ideas."

responses.text: "How much progress has Section 31 made on this project?"
"Is there anything we can do to salvage your reputation with these groups?"
"Would you consider continuing this work with the right people in charge?"

screens.text: "They'll soon have a prototype ready for testing, and if I'd stuck around, I'd be among the first subjects they would have tried it out on. Those Section 31 bastards have the quantum nullifier program on a 'fast track', that's for sure."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'd say it's way too late to smooth things over with Section 31. I might be able to make contact with Captain Bashir and other friends of mine who joined up with the Terran Empire, but they can't offer me much protection against the Terran Empire assassins who are tracking me."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I suppose you know for certain who the 'right people' are? You're a fool if you think that you can really trust anyone with this technology. Besides, my involvement was limited to technical work any competent technician could perform, not the theoretical stuff."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "So what's to be done with me, friend? Are you going to send me back to the tender mercies of Section 31, or do I go to meet an uncertain fate at the hands of the Terran Empire?"

responses.text: "I will see what I can do to have Section 31 deal with you in a lenient manner."
"I will have my contacts in the Terran Empire do what they can to protect you."
"You seem to be an decent engineer. Perhaps there is a place for you in my crew."

intro.text: "I've got a Terran Empire warship in my trails, and they've made it clear they won't be taking prisoners. You'll never know why unless you help me. You'd do it for Captain Sisko, wouldn't you?"

screens.text: "In my universe, Spock didn't live to see what became of his empire. The Klingons and Cardassians rose up, crushed us, made us all their slaves. I was the Intendant's pet, and I was fine with ituntil I realized that no man in any empire is truly free."

responses.text: "So they're after you because you oppose their policies?"
"There has to be more to it than that."
"The Intendant's pet? What do you mean by that?"

screens.text: "Is that so hard to believe? They are an empire, after all."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Of course. I've done things to help anyone in the Empire who wants to live free get out."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Bajoran you call Major Kira is an Intendant in my universe, with the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance. She and I shared a bed for some time, which kept me from realizing how bad other humans had it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm not one for speeches or ceremonies like your Starfleet version is. But I think every man deserves his freedom, and even living under the thumb of a benevolent emperor isn't freedom. Help me tear down the Empire from the inside."

responses.text: "I admire your motives. I'll do what I can."
"The alternative for this region is Section 31. Think about that."
"Of course. We'll find all of them, and... help."

quests.name: Back to School
quests.description: Zefram Cochrane University has been indoctrinating Terran Empire subjects and creating extremists. Help Mirror Sisko sabotage the education program.

intro.text: "In my universe, Zefram Cochrane shot the Vulcans when they showed up on Earth. The Empire still treats him like a godgot his own university, even. It's graduates are true fanatics, brainwashed in the worse sense. Time we shut it down."
intro.response: Infiltrate and Sabotage the Zefram Cochrane University of Education

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

challenges.name: Hack Staff Terminal for Admin Access

ship.name: Constellation Class
ship.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

quests.name: Turncoat Outpost
quests.description: Mirror Sisko has a lead on a Terran Empire outpost commander who might defect to the Federation with a slight nudge. Provide that nudge.

intro.text: "I'm proof that there are plenty of turncoats out there. They just need the right motivation. I've got a Terran Empire commander questioning his path in life, if you've got the motivation."

ship.name: Defiant-Class Ship
ship.flavor: Named after the initial prototype, brought into production during the Dominion War to serve as warships.

quests.name: Baited Hook
quests.description: Hikaru Sulu, a high ranking and ruthless Terran Empire officer, has been deployed. Help Mirror Sisko capture him before he commits more atrocities.

intro.text: "If you met our Sulu, you'd hardly recognize him. He's responsible for countless war crimesor at least, what you'd call war crimes, in this universe. Let's keep him from starting a new tally."

ship.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ship.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

ship.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ship.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

screens.text: "You can't trust this version of Captain Sisko. He's abrasive, quick to action, violent... any empire under his rule would be far worse than Emperor Spock's. And that's all he wantsto take over the Empire."

responses.text: "Do you have any proof of this?"
"I suspected as much. He's a product of his environment."
"That's a very strange uniform you're wearing...."

screens.text: "His past actions in an alternate universe. What I know of his prime counterpart and how he might react. A genetically-enhanced brainnot that I like to mention that much."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "A temporal anomaly plucked me right out of a holosuite. It's proven to be a good conversation starter in these chaotic times."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I've got Garak and several other friends with connections tracking Sisko's movements. If I can prove he's just out to become Emperor Sisko, will you help stop him?"

responses.text: "Yesbut only if you can prove it."
"I trust you, Bashir. I'll stop him no matter what."
"Show me the proof and we'll see."

intro.text: "What did I tell you, friend? Coordinates of Sisko's ship, en route to assassinate Emperor Spock. I don't have any love for the Terran Empire, but a reckless man like Sisko has no business running an empire. You've got to stop him."

screens.text: "You can't blow up a mountain until you're inside the mountain. Don't you understand that?"

responses.text: "You lied to me. How can I trust you?"
"I didn't say I was opposed to your plan... yet."
"You're not much for metaphors, are you?"

screens.text: "No Starfleet officer would take part in an assassination. You're all too good to get your hands dirty."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You think I care what some Starfleet captain thinks of me? Even if it IS me, I don't!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "My empire wouldn't have any rules. You want to go live on Earth? Be my guest. You want to run cargo for the Ferengi? It's your ship. Doesn't that sound like a better way?"

responses.text: "It sounds like chaos to me. You're under arrest."
"You crossed the Terran Empire. They'll decide what to do with you."
"With the right handlers, it could work. Have you heard of Section 31?"

screens.text: "An opportunity has arisen to deal Section 31 a crippling blow. We've learned that one of their secret data archives is stored in the memory banks of a nearby Federation starbase. This data is of the highest importance, possibly even revealing the locations of their agents."

responses.text: "What sorts of opposition can we expect?"
"How do you know the data we're looking for is there?"
"What are you going to do with this data?"

screens.text: "A Federation starbase might be expected to have the typical array of second-rate security forces, average-quality defenses, and limited resistance to the concept of surrendering. That said, occasionally one does find Starfleet officers who will put up a tenacious fight."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We know that Section 31 regularly transfers encrypted volumes of top-secret data to random starbases on regular intervals. We have solid intelligence that such a volume is now stored at the starbase in question, giving us a window of several days to attempt retrieval."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "That is obvious. We will use any captured datafiles to help eliminate Section 31 as a threat. Specifically, we will use captured data to anticipate future attacks on our forces by Section 31-controlled vessels, to break their codes, and to track down and eliminate their agents."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I must ask for your help. I realize that the Terran Empire's methods may be regarded as shocking and brutal, but as my reforms are implemented, we will become the last, best hope for peace in the Alpha Quadrant. Peace backed by strength, and free of Section 31's interference."

responses.text: "The Terran Empire's help will be crucial in the months to come. We accept."
"I'd like to get access to Section 31 files, but don't get too used to my help."
"I would welcome any opportunity to strike a blow against Section 31."

quests.name: Thy Enemy's Secrets
quests.description: Raid a Federation starbase which is temporarily hosting a secret Section 31 data archive.

intro.text: "Boarding the starbase will be difficult, as will breaking the security of its computer systems. The secret Section 31 archives are of primary importance, so it is logical to consider your entire away team expendable until we have what we need from the starbase's memory banks."

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

ship.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ship.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

screens.text: "Our efforts to retrieve Section 31 secrets were successful. We've accessed the itineraries of the top echelon of Section 31 leaders. We'll launch knockout blows against these leaders, at the cost of collateral civilian casualties on several Federation-held planets."

responses.text: "What leads you to believe that these 'knockout blows' would be effective?"
"Aren't you concerned about Federation retaliation?"
"You seek our help after lying to us about your true intentions?"

screens.text: "As with all things, degrees of risk correlating with unknown variables precludes certainty when speaking of potential success rates, but we do have in our possession an indispensable opportunity to reduce a major threat to our existence, and we must seize that opportunity."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We've considered that possibility, but we believe it will be better to decapitate Section 31, whatever the risk. Many in the Federation will be glad to be rid of Section 31, and we'll have a stronger hand to deal with the Federation on our own terms."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The goals I seek, such as the humanitarian reform of the Terran Empire and the liberalization of its culture, are worthy enough that I can easily justify using ethically-questionable methods to achieve them."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Your assistance with our campaign against Section 31 was crucial. We look forward to working with you in the future. At some point, we hope the Terran Empire will achieve the level of reform necessary to become a worthy successor to your Federation."

responses.text: "That seems like an acceptable arrangement, assuming I can take you at your word."
"An alliance could be formidable, but that level of trust will take time to build."
"The Terran Empire's methods still leave much to be desired. We will be watching."

screens.text: "The Terran Empire is building a factory to make Tantalus Devices... weapons that can remotely vaporize a humanoid target. The Tantalus Device can eliminate any man-sized target within its scan range. A fleet of ships equipped with these weapons could become nearly invincible."

responses.text: "What are the Tantalus Device's specifications?"
"Why all the secrecy? Why not tell Starfleet about this threat?"
"Don't we have similar weapons that can deter use of the Tantalus Device?"

screens.text: "Its technical details are still unverified, but it seems to have the same scan range as a transporter, it can destroy three human-sized targets before it needs to be recharged, and it works by suppressing the subatomic bonds keeping the target's atoms together, eradicating it."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Would you want to live in a universe where you knew that a weapon existed that can remove you from existence at any given moment, with impunity? We feel it's better if we kept this concept a secret, and dealt with the threat it poses to the Federation ourselves."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The issue is that the Tantalus Device's effect is nearly impossible to trace to its operator, so deterrence is impossible. At the risk of falling into a moral rabbit-hole, we must take any and all steps necessary to eliminate the Terran Empire's capacity to use this weapon."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We'll beam a strike team to the planet to destroy the Tantalus Device factory, which is deep underground, heavily guarded and on high alert. This means higher friendly casualties, but this is a do-or-die mission already. We can't let the Terran Empire go on making these things."

responses.text: "The Tantalus Device is too dreadful a weapon. I'm in."
"I'm concerned that this course may lead to interstellar war, but I will assist."
"I'm concerned that no alternatives have been thought out, but I will assist."

quests.name: The Annihilation Syndrome
quests.description: Capture the Tantalus Device replication facility. If the Terran Empire makes enough of these horrifying weapons, they could become invincible.

intro.text: "We're now in orbit over the target world. We've detected sentinel drones near the beam-down points, and a Tantalus Device prototype has been activated. Remember, you have to eliminate Terran resistance here at all costs, or they will use their prototype to destroy us."
intro.response: Attack the Terran Empire's Tantalus Device Facility

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

ship.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ship.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

screens.text: "I'm altering the mission parameters. After conferring with the other Section 31 leaders, I've deactivated the det-packs. We'll take the Tantalus Device technology for ourselves, and that will preclude leaving enemy survivors behind to report what we've done."

responses.text: "Have you all gone insane at Section 31?"
"Is this the selectively-murderous future the Federation can look forward to?"
"Are you sure you've gotten all the Terran Empire personnel?"

screens.text: "By 'insane', do you mean, 'appropriately vigilant'? The pros outweigh the cons when it comes to reappropriating this technology, and any Terran Empire witnesses who live to tell the tale will only cause us trouble in the future."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The peace and security of the Federation often costs nefarious people their lives, and I doubt very many will miss the enemies we've disposed of today."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "As certain as we can be. Any Terran Empire survivors can link us to the acquisition of this technology, so we're better off ridding ourselves of this potential liability."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Your ship will take the Tantalus Device prototype, the research and development data, and the engineering schematics out of here, then we'll reactivate the det-packs after everything has been safely removed."

responses.text: "I'll play along this time, but don't count on my cooperation in the future."
"Very well. I trust Section 31 more than the alternatives."
"No one should control this technology. We'll destroy the factory ourselves."

description: Could the Federation be responsible for the temporal crisis? Captain Janeway can't confirm or deny she knows the answer, but she has sent Voyager's EMH to help investigate.

screens.text: "Greetings. I've been instructed to deliver a briefing from Captain Janeway. She regrets she couldn't be here herself, but the risk was too great. If the wrong people discovered what she knew... well, I suppose holograms are expendable."

responses.text: "What is this briefing, and what's the risk entailed?"
"You're not expendable, Doctor. You're the only one she can trust."
"I've got another of you in sickbay. I don't have a spare Janeway."

screens.text: "That's a far more appealing way to look at it, I suppose."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Need I remind you that I'm a learning program? And I've been active far longer than your own EMH, who... never mind."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You had reason to suspect that the Federation, Starfleet, or even Humanity might have been responsible for the temporal anomaly crisis. Captain Janeway's discovered evidence of unlawful experiments in temporal mechanics in the Terran systemright in your own backyard."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Captain Janeway believes these experiments were conducted by Federation scientists, and all but officially sanctioned. If certain parties knew she was aware of it, they could reassign her out of active dutyand it appears you need every Starfleet captain you can get right now."

responses.text: "What was the nature of these experiments?"
"I see. So I should risk my career instead."
"I'll take full responsibility if we're discovered."

screens.text: "I'm a doctor, not a quantum mechanic. Your science officers can explain it all once we arrive."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm told a Starfleet officer's life is full of risk. It's equally true for Starfleet holograms."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm relieved to hear you don't plan to blame it all on the rogue hologram."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Captain Janeway believes one of possibly many such experiments was conducted at Saturn. She's quietly rerouted all Starfleet ships in the area, so you should be undisturbed. I'll download myself into your ship's computers to observe."

responses.text: "Tell the Captain we'll get to the bottom of this."
"Good. It'll be useful to have your perspective."
"Don't touch anything while you're in there."

quests.name: The Rings of Time
quests.description: A secret experiment involving temporal mechanics was conducted here at Saturn. Perform a dangerous study to determine the results!

intro.text: "Here we are. There's no evidence of any experiments being conducted on Saturn's surface. Captain Janeway suggests you examine its rings... a risky proposition, considering their magnetic distortions."

ship.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ship.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

ship.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ship.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

screens.text: "Several of your crew members remain in Sickbay, but they've insisted I deliver a report on their findings. There's been a drastic change in the composition of Saturn's rings. No tholin impurities, four percent less amorphous carbon... in essence, several rings are missing."

responses.text: "Missing? What happened to them?"
"I'll wait to hear from an actual science officer."
"Thank you for helping to treat my crew."

screens.text: "I may just be a lowly hologram, but I assure you I'm capable of reading a PADD."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm a doctor. Also a hologram. Male, too, I suppose."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Local chroniton readings suggest they have moved to another moment in time, but more alarming is the presence of residual subatomic particlessuggesting they were physically, intentionally moved there by a transporter."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Now, if this transporting was done from a ship, we'd be at a dead end. Luckily for you, there appears to be a trail of subatomic particles leading to a fixed locationa research facility of some kind. I suggest you head there next."

responses.text: "Thank you, Doctor. We'll set course at once."
"I'm ashamed to wear the uniform if this is true...."
"An impressive accomplishment, even it caused all this chaos."

intro.text: "My crew and I were brought into this timeline by Starfleet and given a new ship for the express purpose of protecting this technology. And now that you've discovered it... I have my orders. I'm sorry, Captain."

quests.name: Too Greedily and Too Deep
quests.description: You have located a secret Federation research facility for the study of temporal mechanics. Send an away team down to gain access and investigate.

intro.text: "Well, that was unpleasant. For your own mental health, I suggest you put having to execute a famed Starfleet officer out of your mind and focus on the task at handdiscovering more about the Federation's temporal experimentation."

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

ship.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ship.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

ship.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ship.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

screens.text: "Your injured officers once again had to be threatened with physical restraint. This research facility was devoted to a single devicea multiphasic temporal transporter, colloquially referred to by your crew as the 'time transporter.'"

responses.text: "And it's this device that transported Saturn's rings?"
"So Archer was first its subject, then its protector."
"Such research violates the Temporal Prime Directive."

screens.text: "Evidentally, though transport of such a large swath of matter appears to be the straw that broke the camel's back."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "A risky choice, considering that without his work, the Federation wouldn't exist."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Or the regular Prime Directivenot that many captains pay attention to that."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The device is currently inactive. It isn't responsible for any anomalies that have appeared subsequent to its deactivationthough everything prior is theoretically fair game. If you plan to destroy it, may I suggest you at least armor your crew?"

responses.text: "Of course I'm destroying it. This crisis could end today!"
"We'll see. If it caused this crisis, maybe it could end it too...."
"Let's not be hasty. This is groundbreaking technology."

quests.name: The Time Transporter
quests.description: Your away team has discovered an illegal multiphasic temporal transporter developed by Federation scientists. Will you destroy it?

intro.text: "I'm certain Captain Janeway would advocate destroying this device. But you are in command here, Captainjust don't expect me to lie about what happens."

ship.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ship.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

ship.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ship.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

ship.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-D
ship.flavor: A Galaxy-class vessel famously commanded by Captain Picard. Allows for saucer separation in emergency situations.

ship.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701
ship.flavor: A Constitution-class vessel made legend under the command of Captain Kirk. A hardy ship that survived many encounters.

screens.text: "Well, whatever you intended, Captain Janeway will be pleasedthe multiphasic temporal transporter has been destroyed. But I detected some very strange biologic readings just before its demise."

responses.text: "Strange in what way, Doctor?"
"That thing was a death trap, no wonder we're in this mess!"
"I assume since you're still here, that didn't fix everything."

screens.text: "Given that the device has been destroyed and yet temporal anomalies abound, I wouldn't assume they're related."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "There's no need to sound so disappointed."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Somethingor someonewith an incalculable mass and off-the-charts biorhythms appeared briefly, and then vanished. We believe it was brought forth through the transporter prior to its self-destruction."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "It may have been flung right back into the past, it may have been vaporizedI'm afraid it's impossible to tell now. In any case, our investigation into this matter is complete. Captain Janeway is waiting to speak with you at a secure location."

responses.text: "Thank you, Doctor. I'll head there immediately."
"I'll recommend you receive a commendation."
"Make sure all traces of you are out of my computer."

screens.text: "I can't say I'm sorry I haven't been flung back to the Delta Quadrant. But it's troubling to me that we risked our careers, our crew, and our lives going down this rabbit hole, and we're still no closer to the truth."

responses.text: "We may not be anywhere near the bottom yet."
"We know the Federation has broken laws."
"I was the only one who took any risks here."

screens.text: "That's true. Maybe it isn't one temporal mechanics project that started this crisis, but hundreds."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Have they? Get the lawyers involved, and we'd have to prove intent, negligence, who knew what and when."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'll make sure you're properly compensated, both materially and in your service record."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I admit, I'm at a crossroads. We can't have anyone conducting these kinds of experiments, especially now, but I doubt much of the galaxy will believe us when we say the experiments have stopped. What's best for the Federation here? What's best for the galaxy?"

responses.text: "We send our findings to Federation news outlets."
"We inform our superiors, let them handle it."
"We keep this to ourselves. Things are bad enough."

screens.text: "Agreed. With everything going on, though, I wonder if it'll even make the front page."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Technically, I am your superior. And I've decided this information has to be released."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I suppose there's no harm in a delay, at least for a bit."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "If I learn of any more questionable Federation science projects, I'll contact you. Until then, I suppose we're at the mercy of Q. A sobering thought...."

responses.text: Continue

quests.name: Improvised Entry
quests.description: Garak of the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance requests a meeting at Romulus to discuss the turmoil there. This will require you to disguise your ship.

intro.text: "We have an opportunity to capitalize on the turmoil sweeping Romulus. We could influence the Romulan factions who will appoint the next Praetor! Come to Romulus without being detected, and I will share our plans."
intro.response: Plan for a stealthy rendezvous to confer with 'Mirror' Garak near Romulus

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

screens.text: "My plan to restore order on Romulus is simple. We'll back Shinzon to become the next Praetor. The Senate will want to be reassured of his loyalties despite his being a human clone. We must also speak to his ability to defend the Star Empire, by destroying a Starfleet intruder."

responses.text: "I suppose we're meant to be the 'Starfleet intruder.'"
"We came here in good faith to discuss this crisis. How dare you launch an attack?"
"Who is this 'Shinzon,' and why is he so important?"

screens.text: "Yes, I'm so glad you understand where I'm going with this! It saves me having to explain the intricacies of my plan. Your tragic but heroic death in battle will be a victory for Shinzon's faction, helping to cement his bid for the Praetorship... which is good for the Alliance!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Now, now, Captain, in matters of galactic politics, one can't take these things too personally. You and your ship will be destroyed, yes, but your name will live on in the annals of Starfleet heroes, and my people will help Shinzon put an end to Sela's faction. Everybody wins!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Shinzon is the clone of Captain Jean-Luc Picard, created to infiltrate the Federation by the Tal Shiar. He was sent to the dilithium mines of Remus, where he became a respected leader among the Romulan subject races. Your sacrifice will secure his reputation as a great leader!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "A pity to have to use you in this way! I respect those who die for an ideal, even if it is not the one they might have chosen. We can make this experience easy for you, or we can make it interesting. I'll let you decide!"

responses.text: "You might have asked for our support the old-fashioned way. Raise shields!"
"You'll find our ship is more than ready for a fight. Red alert, load torpedoes...."
"Catch us if you can. Helm, go to emergency warp speed."

intro.text: "I have studied every major space battle of the past three centuries, Captain, there is little you could do that would take me by surprise."

screens.text: "Captain, my stronghold on Romulus is under attack by Shinzon's faction. I propose we join forces to prevent Shinzon and his Klingon-Cardassian Alliance supporters from taking over the Romulan Star Empire. In exchange for your help, I would welcome closer Federation ties."

responses.text: "This sounds reasonable, but our ship has been badly damaged. How can we help?"
"Won't the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance be sending a fleet to support Shinzon?"
"Why should I risk the lives of my crew over a Romulan internal affair?"

screens.text: "You'll be able to take advantage of the space battle happening over Remus to reach Romulus unscathed. I've managed to program the planetary defense grid to treat you as an ally, so you've got a window of opportunity."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "They're aware that the more forces they send into our space, the more Shinzon's supporters will switch over to my side. Their support for Shinzon appears to be taking other forms, and since you defeated Shinzon in open battle, they are less likely to risk direct intervention."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You did already when you met with Commander Garak inside Romulan space, Captain. Two wrongs don't make a right, but you are already deeply involved here. Helping me end this conflict before it turns into a general interstellar war is now your moral obligation."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Without doubt, the situation has deteriorated on Romulus. The Senate looks to both Shinzon and myself for leadership, so Shinzon of course chose to assassinate me. After you've replenished your antimatter, scan the capital city. I may need your help soon to stave off anarchy."

responses.text: "Very well, we are on our way to Romulus. Hold on as long as you can."
"I have a feeling we might regret this, but we will intervene to protect you."
"We're on our way, but you will definitely owe us some favors if we succeed."

quests.name: Material Assistance
quests.description: Prevent Shinzon from violently overthrowing the Romulan government by blunting his attacks on Sela's command post on Romulus.

intro.text: "Shinzon's faction has launched another wave of drones in a suicide attack on my command facility. They're trying to blast their way through the fortress walls, bit by bit. I need your help, right now, or soon you'll have to deal with Shinzon in command of the whole Star Empire."
intro.response: Disrupt Drone Attacks on Sela's Stronghold

screens.text: "I'm alive. My command post is badly damaged, and I'll have to find a new base facility, but my forces have prevailed. I'm in a position to start pushing back against Shinzon's loyalists, and reacting to the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance's aggression, thanks to you."

responses.text: "What do you intend to do with Shinzon if you find him?"
"What is your vision of the Romulan Empire's future?"
"What can you do to help the Federation with the temporal anomaly crisis?"

screens.text: "Death by disruptor beam, without mercy. Allowing Shinzon to escape would only lead to another attempt at violent overthrow of the regime. I realize that idea may not sit well with your high-minded Federation morals, but this is the way things are in the Romulan Star Empire."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We will do whatever it takes to secure our borders, rebuild, and help our people become prosperous. Naturally, there are those in the Star Empire who would oppose these aims. I'm looking forward to dealing harshly with traitors standing in the way of our success."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We've barely been able to cope with the disruptions caused by the temporal anomalies, let alone take time to learn about them. We can discuss pooling our information at some point, we will all find it difficult to maintain order if invaders from other timelines keep appearing."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I expect the Romulan Senate to appoint me as the new Praetor within the next few hours. Then I will have plenty of work to do, both in rebuilding Romulan forces, crushing her enemies, and scouring the Empire for Shinzon and other traitors. I could certainly use your help."

responses.text: "You can count on our help, so long as your requests serve Federation interests."
"We prefer to look to the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance to restore order."
"I look forward to helping you defeat our mutual enemies."

quests.name: The Raptors' Fury
quests.description: Stop one of Shinzon's warbirds on a suicide dive into the Romulan capital city.

intro.text: "One of Shinzon's warbirds is on a decaying orbit, aligned for an intentional impact in a major city. We don't have any ships in position that can stop it... so we're asking for your help. Millions of innocent Romulans could be killed if that ship hits the surface."
intro.response: Attempt to intercept the suicide warbird.

screens.text: "Do not interfere with our campaign to overthrow Sela. Romulan space will soon be in our control, and a new era will dawn for the oppressed peoples of the Star Empire. With help from the Klingons and Cardassians, the Romulans shall feel our wrath, as we have felt theirs for centuries."

responses.text: "Aren't you a clone of Jean-Luc Picard, and didn't you lead a Reman uprising once?"
"Perhaps it is time to put aside our past differences and ally against Sela?"
"What makes you think that terrorizing the Romulans won't lead to chaos?"

screens.text: "Your history has been turned upside-down, Captain. The context which drove my actions has been completely changed. Perhaps in a new timeline, two enemies can see themselves as friends. It is no different with us, Captain. You are either useful to me or a hindrance."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "You think I would trust you so carelessly, after once having fought you in a space battle? No, my dear Captain, you may take any action you wish against Sela, but it will take many successes and a great deal of dedication to earn my allegiance."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "What revolution ever comes without first inflicting chaos on those who presume to rule? We will shake the Star Empire to its foundations, and its people will soon understand that the price of my protection is service."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Sela seems to have found my dreadnought, the Scimitar, under construction. I will have to destroy it, before she can get it operational. I must go, dear Captain... I mustn't let my friends in the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance think I've lost my edge."

responses.text: "We will meet you there, and together we shall engage Sela's forces."
"We will follow you there, and do whatever it takes to stop you."
"We will go and attempt to broker a cease-fire."

intro.text: "It isn't you I'm after, Captain. If you won't stand down, you'll have to be neutralized."

screens.text: "Sela is trying to keep me away from the Scimitar... That ship, when active, will have as much power as a small fleet, all by itself. Sela will dare to use any weapon at her disposal. This is why I seek help from the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance."

responses.text: "Why did the Romulans waste the resources to build such a monster of a ship?"
"Is there no way the two of you can agree to stop this destructive conflict?"
"Do you know any other way but the path of violence?"

screens.text: "We are always fighting someone, Captain. The Federation, the Klingons, the Borg, the Husnock... there is always someone at our borders, inspiring us to build ever-bigger warships. Your huge Sovereign-class battleships, are those necessary for the Federation's defense?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "It is far beyond negotiation, Captain. We have no other motive but to destroy each other. There can be only one of us now."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "In time, when I have achieved absolute rule, and have cleared Romulan society of all potential adversaries... then perhaps I might turn my attentions toward establishing a new dynasty, perhaps one which will merge with the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance someday."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Sela's forces still press the attack, but there is no sign of Sela herself. If my ship should be destroyed, Captain, she will likely finish you off as well. Your ship may as well fight at my side, and retrieve any useful components nearby for the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance."

responses.text: "I see little alternative but to join you, and wait for Sela's ship to appear."
"We will do our best to defend you against this onslaught."
"No offense, but we will take our chances and appeal to Sela's better nature."

quests.name: Striking at Shadows
quests.description: Sela has released a series of sensor decoys and mines to impede Shinzon's fleet, but your ship is vulnerable to them. Disable the mines and decoys.

intro.text: "Stop where you are... your ship has wandered into one of Sela's minefields. If you want to live, I would suggest taking steps to chart a path through the minefield."

screens.text: "Thank you for helping to draw Shinzon and his Klingon-Cardassian Alliance friends out into the open. I altered the frequency of the temporal anomaly in the Romulus system to re-trigger the Reman uprising of several years ago. It worked perfectly, more Senators support me now."

responses.text: "You made the Reman uprising happen, just to get more political support?"
"Would you mind sharing how you were able to 'tune' the anomaly in that way?"
"We were used as sacrificial bait this entire time? It was all a ruse?"

screens.text: "What terrifies the Senate most is losing their power, being hauled out of office and murdered, or being thrown in a Tal Shiar dungeon. All I had to do was contrive a situation which would drive the remaining Senators into my ranks. How does it work on your homeworld?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "That will have to remain a Romulan state secret for now, though I suspect it won't be long before your scientists learn how to perform the procedure. When they do, we'll be ready to counter any Starfleet attempt to intervene against us using time travel."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Everyone has a role to play in one of my plans. You, Shinzon, and even the illustrious Captain Picard. Don't ever underestimate me. The only reason you are still alive is because you are still of further use to me."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Now that Shinzon is dead, and my claim to the Praetorship is secure, I expect you have Starfleet business to attend to. You have thirty-six hours to leave Romulan space. Any deviation, and you will be fired upon."

responses.text: "It has been a pleasure working with you, Praetor Sela. Until we meet again."
"There's no telling if Shinzon is truly dead. You may need us again, Sela."
"Nothing will make me happier than to put at least fifty light-years between us."

quests.name: One Future Ends
quests.description: As Telek R'Mor arrives at the rendezvous point, a temporal rift has suddenly appeared. Scan this newly-formed temporal anomaly for signs of trouble.

intro.text: "I've some research on this temporal crisis I think the Federation might be interested inwait, there's a temporal rift opening up at my location! Hurry, this is our best opportunity to study it!

screens.text: "There's a temporal anomaly here! I'll have to speak quickly, then, in case it sends me somewhere else. I survived a temporal displacement from 2367 to the present day. Members of my family were killed in the recent fighting, and I don't trust either faction with my research."

responses.text: "What's so important about your research?"
"Why are you afraid of both factions?"
"How were you able to contact Starfleet Command so easily?"

screens.text: "My study of micro-wormholes could have significant benefits to transport and communication. I may have discovered a way to easily create and maintain them, making it possible to link together the galaxy. Starships and interstellar war as we know it, could become redundant."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "All of the respectable members of the Senate have vanished or gone into hiding since the temporal anomalies appeared. I don't trust either Shinzon or Sela not to use my research for warfare. My micro-wormhole research might be used to create weapons that could destroy planets."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "In 2351, I was serving on a science vessel, and made contact with the U.S.S. Voyager through a micro-wormhole. The Voyager was then in the Delta Quadrant, and some twenty years in the future. I used the frequency Captain Janeway gave me, to send my message."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I can help you decipher my research, and also deliver a set of messages from the U.S.S. Voyager's crew... outdated by now, but I did promise to deliver them. I can also provide latinum in exchange for safe passage into Federation space."

responses.text: "Gifts won't be necessary, we'll be happy to escort you to a Federation starbase."
"We'll have to get clearance from Starfleet first."
"Your vessel will need to submit to a Federation entry inspection."

screens.text: "Stand by... Something unusual is happening near the temporal rift. A Starfleet ship has appeared... I'm under attack!"

responses.text: Continue

intro.text: "That Starfleet ship that just came out of the temporal rift... it's firing on me! I'll fly out of the way, but I'll need your help to make him stop the attack!"

screens.text: "This is Crewman Simon Tarses... medical specialist aboard the U.S.S. Hadley. The ship has suffered extensive damage, and the officers are all either killed or incapacitated. We surrender. Repeat, we surrender..."

responses.text: "Why did the Hadley attack us, Mister Tarses?"
"Where did the Hadley come from, Mister Tarses?"
"What can you tell us about that temporal rift, Mister Tarses?"

screens.text: "After we saw what R'Mor's research led to, what his invention allowed to happen to the galaxy in the 29th century, we tracked R'Mor down to this moment in time. Captain Brewster may have assumed you were instrumental in this somehow."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We left Starbase 12 three weeks ago... but we were soon pulled into the 29th century by a temporal anomaly, and found the galaxy in chaos. R'Mor's micro-wormhole technology destroyed every major inhabited world... Whatever his research is, it must be eliminated, immediately.."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We were pulled into the 29th century by a temporal anomaly three of your weeks ago. In the future, the galaxy was left in ruins by Telek R'Mor's micro-wormhole technology. We spent years there, working on a time portal that could return us to our original era... and succeeded."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I don't know how to respond to these allegations. Am I to be slaughtered out of hand because some deranged Starfleet crew thinks I am responsible for something that hasn't happened yet? Are you going to defend these people?"

responses.text: "Calm down. We will investigate, and get to the bottom of this incident."
"I can certainly understand their captain's motivation. We will investigate this."
"This is a clear violation of the Temporal Prime Directive, at minimum."

quests.name: Researching Future History
quests.description: Find evidence to support or challenge the commander of the Hadley's decision to retroactively assassinate Doctor R'Mor.

intro.text: "The bridge crew received several holofiles from our contacts in the twenty-ninth century, detailing the connections to Doctor R'Mor's work. You may find them helpful, if you can coax them out of our damaged memory banks, that is."
intro.response: Reconstruct Timeline Data to Prove R'Mor's Innocence

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

screens.text: "I am being condemned for something I'm hardly responsible for! Yes, this is apparently my theory, but in the next five centuries, someone's implementation of that theory was faulty! Is every inventor to be punished for the way their inventions are misused in subsequent eras?"

responses.text: "Your technology seems quite vulnerable to tampering, doesn't it?"
"Shouldn't this technology be destroyed, knowing what you know now?"
"Are the vulnerabilities of your technology resolvable?"

screens.text: "I don't know what the design parameters for a micro-wormhole network would even be yet! How should I know what went wrong five hundred years into the future?"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Does leaving this idea for someone else to stumble upon in the future make any sense? We must learn as much as we can about micro-wormholes, in the present, and leave the future for others to worry about. Forbidding avenues of research is counterproductive."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I wouldn't know unless I implemented a prototype micro-wormhole link, outside the laboratory. There could be thousands of ways to build a micro-wormhole network that wouldn't transmit an antimatter explosion instantly to all nodes on the network."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We've restored ship control and medical facilities, Captain. The Hadley is ready to return to Federation space. What will become of Doctor R'Mor?"

responses.text: "We'll accept R'Mor's offer to bring him and his research to the Federation."
"Perhaps we can use this research to bargain with either Sela or Shinzon."
"The galaxy isn't ready for this kind of innovation. We'll destroy the research."

quests.name: Trust Issues
quests.description: Praetor Sela is the target of an assassin, and believes it is Federation who is attempting to have her deposed. Prevent the situation from escalating.

intro.text: "Your interest in my empire has not escaped me, Captain. And I have to wonder, is that interest malicious in nature? An assassin hounds my footsteps and my agents tell me they bear the hallmarks of the Federation. Should they succeed, know I will be avenged one hundred fold."
"I see this assailant is fleeing in a Klingon-Cardassian Alliance ship. The Federation isn't that clever... so perhaps this isn't your doing after all. Stop that ship, and I'll know for sure."

screens.text: "It appears you've saved my life, but appearances can be deceiving. I won't consider this matter settled until the assassin is handed over for interrogation. And punishment."

responses.text: "The Federation would never condone an assassination, Praetor."
"Surely its obvious that the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance is behind this."
"Show me proof that your accusations are well-founded or keep them to yourself."

screens.text: "No, no, of course not. You simply turn a blind eye and plea ignorance."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "There are few who would address me in such a tone. Very few. It's almost refreshing."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'll permit you to conduct your own investigation, provided you cooperate with the Tal Shiar. Bring me the one who'd dare threaten my life and I'll let this rest, but if it really was the Federation that dispatched this killer, then I will have a great deal more to say."

responses.text: "As allies of the Romulan people, we will deal with this threat accordingly."
"And if this proves to be a deception of your own, I promise we will have words."
"Whoever is responsible for such vile acts will be made to account for them."

quests.name: Lost Legacy
quests.description: Sela's assassin has fled the scene, but is sure to try again. Lead a search to apprehend the killer before Sela comes to harm.

intro.text: "Convenient that the assassin has escaped. Let me be clear, there will be no trust between us until the one who dared strike at me is brought to face my judgment."

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

ship.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

screens.text: "Why? Why would you stop me? You have to know the kind of woman Sela has become. She is my worst fears brought to life. I died trying to spare her from this fate, it's the least I can do to give her peace now."

responses.text: "Murder is never the answer, however you try to justify it."
"She's the model Romulan. Truthfully, I admire her."
"I would like nothing less than to indulge you, but it's too costly to kill her."

screens.text: "I wanted to believe that, but I've seen the darkest places first hand. Death would be a mercy for her, for me, for everyone she'd harm."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "She's a deceitful, greedy, sociopath. There is nothing a Starfleet officer should admire about my daughter."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Maybe it was selfish of me, but I brought this about. It was my responsibility to fix things."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Hello, Mother. I've heard so much about you. The spirited woman that enamored my father and tried to deny me my birthright. Truth be told, you never made much of an impression when you were around. Watching you die, however, taught me so much."

responses.text: "This is an opportunity to make up lost time, bond, and understand one another."
"You watched your own mother die?"
"Are you satisfied that the Federation had no intentions of killing you?"

screens.text: "No, she had the right idea. I am no longer the daughter she desired and she is nothing but an ugly reminder to me."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "My father thought it important for me to know how and why my mother died. We are not a squeamish people."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I suppose. Even the Federation would not be so foolish as to send an assassin related to me by blood."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'd like nothing more than to see this stain on my ancestry washed clean, but I can't be certain her death wouldn't affect me in some way. I'll have to be content with burying her in the darkest mines of Remus instead."

responses.text: "The Federation will not allow that Sela, but she will stand trial for her crimes."
"Romulan filial ties are touching. I want no more part in your family affairs."
"I'll make sure the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance knows of this. Perhaps they'll be more sympathetic."

screens.text: "Praetor Sela now intends to use thalaron weapons against the Alliance! Though you are the one who outmaneuvered us at Vulcan, you have proven yourself useful to us. Shall we join our forces and eliminate this new Romulan threat?"

responses.text: "What's so disturbing about thalaron weapons?"
"Hasn't the Alliance forced the Romulans to resort to these kinds of tactics?"
"If these thalaron devices are so horrible, why not go after them yourselves?"

screens.text: "Thalaron radiation is a cowardly form of attack. It is a beam which can turn its victims into ashes in seconds... and there is no defense against it. It is no way for an honorable Klingon warrior to die!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We have beaten the Romulans with honor in every battle, though they fight like cowards! Their blood-debts must now be paid by surrendering to the Alliance!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Alliance forces are massing for battle in the Narendra sector, far from the thalaron weapon. We need someone who has a fast ship, and the skills necessary to succeed at this mission... Someone like you!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We know the Romulans are mounting the thalaron generator aboard a ship called the Scimitar, at a defensive starbase. Get inside the system's defense grid, get aboard the Scimitar and destroy its thalaron generator before it rejoins their fleet."

responses.text: "Allowing the Romulans to use these weapons is too dangerous. We shall intervene."
"I'm unconvinced that this weapon is as frightening as you say, but we will help."
"I agree, but my efforts on your behalf should earn greater rewards in the future."

quests.name: Death's Endeavor
quests.description: Take out a Romulan prototype weapon of mass destruction, and help the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance decisively beat the Romulans in this region.

intro.text: "If you value your lives, stop the Romulans from deploying the thalaron weapon! Destroy it at all costs, or they will literally feast over our ashes! Q'apla!"

screens.text: "Now that you've secured the thalaron generator, you may withdraw your away team. We will cut the device out of the Scimitar's hull, and take it back to the Alliance outpost."

responses.text: "The plan was to destroy the thalaron technology. Aren't we safer without it?"
"What makes you think thalaron technology is any safer in your hands?"
"How do I know this technology won't be used against the Federation?"

screens.text: "The plan has changed," the Klingon says. "The Alliance is stronger with thalaron technology than without it. Fate favors the strong!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Klingons have honor, and Romulans do not! The Romulans built this disturbing weapon in the first place, to try and exterminate us. Those who descend to this level of dishonor do not deserve to live!"

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "If your so-called 'Federation' doesn't behave like cowards, then it has nothing to fear from thalaron-equipped Alliance warships."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "These thalaron weapons will soon be used to finish Sela and her followers off for good. We will install a Romulan of our choosing to oversee this region, and we will have finally carved out a home in this new galaxy for ourselves."

responses.text: "There are worse people I could think of to own this technology."
"I will work to see that this thalaron generator never reaches operational status."
"May your efforts to revive this horrifying technology meet nothing but failure."

screens.text: "The Tal Shiar has discovered evidence that the Alliance is getting desperate. They plan to escalate by using metagenic weapons against Romulan-held worlds. Destroy their weapons lab, and we destroy the Alliance for good."

responses.text: "Why is the elimination of a metagenic weapons lab such a priority?"
"These coordinates... isn't this a harmless Klingon colony world?"
"Wouldn't it be better to work on restoring order to the Romulan Empire first?"

screens.text: "Apart from the fact that metagenics are horrifying biological weapons which propagate on a living world and soon destroy its entire biosphere? Evidently the Alliance never heard of our ban on these items, and has contrived to develop them within striking distance of our empire."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "I'm not fooled by the enemy's attempts to disguise their weapons labs as civilian buildings. The Tal Shiar learned that metagenic research was taking place there, and now our scout vessels confirm this. The entire colony must be destroyed, if necessary, to stop this research."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The lab's location is too close to our borders for comfort. So long as forbidden bio-weapons research is taking place there, eliminating it will be our top priority."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "If saving the so-called 'innocent' Klingons colonists is so important to you, I suppose I can offer you the task of beaming into the weapons research facility and destroying it, without collateral damage to the inhabitants. Does that sound acceptable?"

responses.text: "We stand ready to assist, though we'd prefer to have Romulan help."
"We'll accept the mission, though we question its necessity."
"Pre-emption of the metagenic weapons is key to our security. Let's go."

intro.text: "Not so fast, Captain! I'd assumed our friend Praetor Sela might have sent you after our metagenic labs... against unarmed scientists? Since Sela has gone down to lead the assault on the planet herself, I'll deal with you first, and then trap Sela on the surface."

screens.text: "Your defeat of Garak's ship caused the Alliance fleet to withdraw. Our fleet was then able to complete your mission of securing the metagenic weapons. They should be beamed aboard the Scimitar shortly. The defending Alliance scum never had a chance."

responses.text: "Wasn't the original objective to destroy the metagenic weapons research?"
"What will become of the Klingon colony?"
"Why did the Alliance fleet withdraw?"

screens.text: "Yes, but we realized it would be a waste of knowledge that could be used to our benefit. With advanced metagenic weapons in our arsenal, we can create high-speed subspace transmissions which can destroy the biospheres of enemy worlds within hours of a war starting."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "Sadly for the Klingon inhabitants, we wouldn't want to leave any evidence or survivors  which would give the Alliance reason to believe that we now possess their metagenic weapons technology. The colony will be completely destroyed by our orbital barrage."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "We used several Tal Shiar deception ships to bait their fleet several parsecs out of position, thinking they were chasing our main strike force of D'deridex-class warbirds, but they were only sensor ghosts. The planet was left completely open to our attack."

responses.text: Continue

screens.text: "The Klingon military forces  have been destroyed, and the metagenics weapon technologies are in our hands, and the so-called 'Klingon-Cardassian Alliance' forces are retreating in disarray, thanks to you. Odd that it took a Starfleet Captain to help us win..."

responses.text: "The destruction of the colony is tragic, but many tragic things happen in a war."
"The alternatives to this were far worse. Congratulations on your victory."
"Commiting of atrocities like this will hardly improve relations between us."

quests.name: Evacuation Orders
quests.description: Hirogen hunters are headed for Xindi space. Defend this Federation member against the invaders!

intro.text: "This Alpha Quadrant may not be our home, but we intend to make the most of this unexpected vacation. We will hunt the most exotic and elusive preysuch as your Xindi."
"So you cannot be hunted on land. You will die just as easily in space!"

quests.name: Field Modifications
quests.description: Hostile Hirogen are after the Dominion, hiding in Xindi space. Upgrade their ships' weapons and defenses to overpower the Hirogen in combat.

intro.text: "We must be able to defend ourselvesand the Dominion seeking asylumfrom the Hirogen. We request Starfleet assistance with upgrading our ships."

reward.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.
